  9068                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9069                                  ;								:
  9070                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  9071                                  ;								:
  9072                                  ;								:
  9073                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  9074                                  ;								:
  9075                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  9076                                  ;								:
  9077                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  9078                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  9079                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  9080                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  9081                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  9082                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9083                                  ;								:
  9084                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9085                                  ;								:
  9086                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9087                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9088                                  ;								:
  9089                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9090                                  
  9091                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9092                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9093                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9094                                  
  9095                                  ;19/07/2019
  9096                                  ;09/03/2019
  9097                                  
  9098                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9099                                  
  9100                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9101                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9102                                  
  9103 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9104 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9105 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9106 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9107 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9108 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9109 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9110 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9111 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9112 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9113 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9114 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9115 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9116 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9117 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9118                                  
  9119                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9120                                  
  9121 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9122 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9123 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9124 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9125 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9126 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9127 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9128 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9129 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9130 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9131 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9132 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9133 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9134 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9135 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9136 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9137 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9138 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9139 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9140 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9141                                  
  9142                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9143                                  
  9144                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9145                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9146                                  
  9147                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9148                                  ;
  9149                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9150                                  ;
  9151                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9152                                  ;
  9153                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9154                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9155                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9156                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9157                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9158                                  ;
  9159                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9160                                  ;
  9161                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9162                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9163                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9164                                  ;
  9165                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9166                                  
  9167                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9168 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9169 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9170                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9171 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9172                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9173 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9174 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9175                                  					; get binary hours
  9176                                  					; convert to bcd
  9177 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9178                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9179 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9180 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9181 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9182                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9183 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9184 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9185 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9186                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9187 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9188 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9189 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9190 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9191 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9192                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9193                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9194                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9195 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9196                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9197 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9198 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9199                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9200 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9201                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9202                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9203                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9204 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9205 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9206 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9207                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9208                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9209                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9210 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9211 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9212                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9213 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9214 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9215 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9216                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9217                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9218 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9219 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9220 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9221                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9222                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9223                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9224 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9225                                  no_cmos_2:
  9226                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9227                                  		; cf=0				
  9228                                  		;clc
  9229 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9230                                  
  9231                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9232                                  
  9233                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9234                                  
  9235                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9236                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9237                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9238                                  ;
  9239                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9240                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9241                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9242                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9243                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9244                                  ;
  9245                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9246                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9247                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9248                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9249                                  
  9250                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9251 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9252 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9253                                  
  9254                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9255                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9256                                  ;
  9257                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9258                                  ;	       ----------------
  9259                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9260                                  ;
  9261                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9262                                  ;
  9263                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9264                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9265                                  ;		1,193,180
  9266                                  ;
  9267                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9268                                  ;
  9269                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9270                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9271                                  ;		59,659
  9272                                  ;
  9273                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9274                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9275                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9276                                  ;
  9277                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9278                                  ; multiply by 5
  9279                                  
  9280 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9281 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9282                                  					; multiply by 5
  9283 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9284 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9285 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9286 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9287 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9288 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9289 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9290                                  
  9291                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9292                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9293                                  
  9294 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9295 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9296                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9297 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9298 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9299 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9300                                  
  9301                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9302                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9303                                  
  9304 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9305 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9306                                  
  9307                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9308                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9309                                  
  9310 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9311 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9312 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9313 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9314                                  noadj:					
  9315 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9316 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9317                                  
  9318                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9319                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9320                                  
  9321 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9322 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9323 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9324 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9325 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9326 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9327 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9328 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9329                                  
  9330                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9331                                  
  9332 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9333 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9334 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9335 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9336 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9337 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9338 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9339 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9340 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9341                                  
  9342                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9343                                  
  9344                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9345                                  
  9346                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9347                                  ;
  9348                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9349                                  ;
  9350                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9351                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9352                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9353                                  ;
  9354                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9355                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9356                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9357                                  ;			else
  9358                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9359                                  ;		}
  9360                                  ;
  9361                                  ; USES : AX
  9362                                  ;
  9363                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9364                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9365                                  ;
  9366                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9367                                  
  9368                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9369                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9370 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9371 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9372                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9373                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9374                                  					; midnight
  9375                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9376 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9377 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9378 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9379                                  					; and not flag
  9380 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9381 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9382                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9383                                  
  9384                                  inc_case:				
  9385 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9386 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9387 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9388                                  no_rollover:				
  9389 00000494 C3                      		retn

  9418                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9419                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9420                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9421                                  
  9422                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9423                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9424                                  
  9425                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9426                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9427                                  
  9428                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9429                                  
  9430                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9431                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9432                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9433                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9434                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9435                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9436                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9437                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9438                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9439                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9440                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9441                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9442                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9443                                  
  9444                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9445                                  
  9446                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9447                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9448                                  ;
  9449                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9450                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9451                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9452                                  ;   else
  9453                                  ;	set slow = value
  9454                                  ;   ...
  9455                                  ;*********************************************
  9456                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9457                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9458                                  ;*	 use slow
  9459                                  ;*   else
  9460                                  ;*	 use fast
  9461                                  ;*********************************************
  9462                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9463                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9464                                  ;	use slow
  9465                                  ;   else
  9466                                  ;	use fast
  9467                                  ;   ...
  9468                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9469                                  ;
  9470                                  ;
  9471                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9472                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9473                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9474                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9475                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9476                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9477                                  
  9478                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9479                                  
  9480                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9481                                  
  9482                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9483

  9486                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9487

  9506                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9509                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close

  9516                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9556                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9557                                  
  9558                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9559                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9560                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9561                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9562                                  ;
  9563                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9564                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9565                                  
  9566                                  SetDrive:	
  9567                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9568 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9569                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9570 000004CF 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9571 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9572 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9573 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9574 000004DB 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9575 000004DD F9                      		stc
  9576                                  X_SetDrv:				
  9577 000004DE C3                      		retn
  9578                                  
  9579                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9580                                  
  9581                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9582                                  
  9583                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9584                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9585                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9586                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9587                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9588                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9589                                  
  9590                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
  9591 000004DF E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
  9592 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9593 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9594                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9595 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9596                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9597 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9598                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9599                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9600 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9601                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9602 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9603                                  					; fnon_removable
  9604 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9605 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9606 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9607                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9608                                  
  9609                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9610                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9611 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9612 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9613                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9614 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
  9615                                  
  9616                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9617                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9618                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9619                                  
  9620 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9621 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9622 00000512 E89F12                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9623 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9624 00000517 E8F713                  		call	haschange
  9625 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9626                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9627                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9628                                  			
  9629 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9630 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9631 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9632                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9633 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9634 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
  9635 0000052B EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
  9636                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9637                                  
  9638                                  Media_Unk:				
  9639 0000052D 4E                      		dec	si		; ; Return "I don't know"
  9640                                  
  9641                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
  9642                                  		; Clean up the left overs
  9643                                  Media_Done:	
  9644                                  		; 19/10/2022			
  9645 0000052E 06                      		push	es
  9646 0000052F C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  9647 00000533 2689770E                		mov	[es:bx+0Eh], si	; [es:bx+trans]
  9648 00000537 07                      		pop	es
  9649 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si
  9650 0000053A 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
  9651 0000053C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9652 00000541 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
  9653 00000543 E85713                  		call	media_set_vid
  9654                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:			
  9655 00000546 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9656                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
  9657                                  ret_carry_clear:			
  9658 0000054B F8                      		clc			; volidok
  9659 0000054C C3                      		retn
  9660                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9661                                  
  9662                                  err_exitj:				
  9663 0000054D E88106                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
  9664                                  ret81:					
  9665 00000550 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
  9666 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9667                                  
  9668                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9669                                  
  9670                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9671                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9672                                  ; drive.
  9673                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9674                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9675                                  ; returns in si:
  9676                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9677                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9678                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9679                                  ;
  9680                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9681                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9682                                  
  9683                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9684                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9685 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9686 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9687 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9688                                  					; get stored time
  9689 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9690 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9691 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9692 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9693 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9694 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9695 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9696 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9697                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9698 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9699 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9700 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9701                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9702                                  
  9703                                  timepassed:				
  9704 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9705                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9706 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9707                                  
  9708                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9709                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9710 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9711                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9712 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9713                                  
  9714                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9715                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9716                                  Err_Exitj2:
  9717 00000583 EBC8                    		jmp	short err_exitj
  9718                                  
  9719                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9720                                  
  9721                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9722                                  
  9723                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9724                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.
  9725                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9726                                  
  9727                                  		; 19/10/2022

  9742 0000059D 72B1                    		jb	short ret81
  9743                                  		;cmp	ds:set_id_flag,	2 ; already, volume_label set from boot
  9744 0000059F 803E[0A05]02            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 2
  9745                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 ; record to bds table?
  9746 000005A4 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9747 000005A9 740A                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; do not set it again from	root dir
  9748                                  					; otherwise, conventional boot record
  9749                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	; do we	have changeline	support?
  9750 000005AB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0

  9756

  9762                                  
  9763                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9764                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
  9765                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
  9766                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
  9767                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
  9768                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data. 
  9769                                  ;NB: It is fine to corrupt cx because this is not a return value and anyway
  9770                                  ;this returns to Chardev_entry (msbio1.asm) where all registers are 
  9771                                  ;restored before returning to the caller.

  9871                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9872                                  
  9873                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9874                                  
  9875                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9876                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9877                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9878                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9879                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9880                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9881                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9882                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9883                                  ;
  9884                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9885                                  ;
  9886                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9887                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9888                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9889                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9890                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9891                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9892                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9893                                  ;
  9894                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9895                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9896                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9897                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9898                                  
  9899                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9900                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable

  9903 000005FF E99500                  		jmp	getret_exit

  9905

  9909 00000604 53                      		push	bx
  9910                                  
  9911                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
  9912                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
  9913                                  		; have a valid boot sector.

 10039                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10040                                  
 10041                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10042                                  
 10043                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10044                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10045                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10046                                  ;
 10047                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10048                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10049                                  
 10050                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10051                                  
 10052                                  readbootsec:	
 10053 000006AC B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10054 000006AE B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10055 000006B1 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
 10056 000006B4 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
 10057 000006B6 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10058                                  
 10059                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10060                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10061                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10062                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10063                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10064                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10065                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10066                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10067                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10068                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10069                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10070                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10071                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10072                                  		; informations
 10073                                  
 10074                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10075                                  
 10076                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10077 000006B8 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10078 000006BD 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10079 000006BF 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10080 000006C4 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10081 000006C6 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10082 000006CB 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10083 000006CD 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10084 000006D2 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10085                                  
 10086                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10087                                  ;
 10088                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10089                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10090                                  ;;
 10091                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10092                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10093                                  ;;
 10094                                  ;;check_signature:
 10095                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10096                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10097                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10098                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10099                                  
 10100                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10101                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10102                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10103                                  
 10104                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10105                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
 10106 000006D4 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10107                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10108 000006D7 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10109 000006D9 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10110 000006DB 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10111                                  
 10112                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10113                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10114                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10115                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10116                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10117                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10118                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10119                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10120                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10121                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10122                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10123                                  
 10124                                  checksinglesided:
 10125 000006DD A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10126 000006E0 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10127 000006E2 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10128 000006E4 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10129 000006E6 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10130 000006E8 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10131 000006EE 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10132 000006F0 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10133 000006F5 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10134                                  
 10135                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10136                                  
 10137                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10138 000006F7 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10139                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10140 000006FC EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10141                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10142                                  
 10143                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10144 000006FE 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10145                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10146                                  movbpb_ret:
 10147                                  gooddsk:				
 10148 000006FF F8                      		clc
 10149                                  err_ret:
 10150 00000700 C3                      		retn
 10151                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10152                                  
 10153                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10154                                  ;err_ret:				
 10155                                  		;retn
 10156                                  
 10157                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10158                                  
 10159                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10160                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10161                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10162                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10163                                  ;
 10164                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10165                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10166                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10167                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10168                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10169                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10170                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10171                                  
 10172                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10173                                  
 10174                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10175                                  movbpb:	
 10176 00000701 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10177                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10178                                  					; sectors per unit
 10179 00000705 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10180                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10181                                  					; number of directory entries
 10182 00000709 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10183                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10184                                  					; size of drive
 10185 0000070D 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10186                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10187                                  					; media	descriptor
 10188 00000711 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10189                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10190                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10191 00000714 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10192                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10193                                  					; sectors per track

 10212                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10213                                  
 10214                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10215                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10216                                  ;by es:di.
 10217                                  
 10218                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10219                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.

 10221                                  ;      the boot record information.

 10223                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.

 10269                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10270                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10271                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10272                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10273                                  ; output:
 10274                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10275                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit

 10277                                  
 10278                                  readfat:	
 10279                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10280                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10281 0000076D 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10282 0000076F B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10283                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10284 00000772 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10285 00000775 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret

 10287                                  bad_fat_ret:

 10289                                  
 10290                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10291                                  
 10292                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10293                                  
 10294                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10295                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10296                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10297                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10298                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10299                                  ;		dh has head
 10300                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10301                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10302                                  ;
 10303                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10304                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10305                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10306                                  ;
 10307                                  ;		carry set
 10308                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10309                                  ;
 10310                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10311                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10312                                  
 10313                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10314                                  
 10315                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10316                                  read_sector:	
 10317 0000077A 55                      		push	bp
 10318 0000077B BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10319 0000077E 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10320 00000782 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10321                                  rd_ret:					
 10322 00000785 06                      		push	es
 10323 00000786 1E                      		push	ds
 10324 00000787 07                      		pop	es
 10325 00000788 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10326 0000078B CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10327                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10328                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10329                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10330 0000078D 07                      		pop	es
 10331 0000078E 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10332                                  rd_rty:					
 10333 00000790 E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10334 00000793 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10335 00000795 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10336                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10337                                  					; fnon_removable
 10338 0000079A 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10339 0000079C 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10340 000007A1 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10341 000007A3 50                      		push	ax
 10342 000007A4 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10343 000007A5 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10344                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10345                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10346                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10347                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10348 000007A9 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10349 000007AB 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10350                                  		; 
 10351 000007AE 1F                      		pop	ds
 10352 000007AF A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10353 000007B2 58                      		pop	ax
 10354                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10355 000007B3 06                      		push	es
 10356 000007B4 1E                      		push	ds
 10357 000007B5 07                      		pop	es
 10358 000007B6 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10359 000007B9 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10360                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10361                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10362                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10363 000007BB 07                      		pop	es
 10364 000007BC 9C                      		pushf
 10365 000007BD 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10366 000007C2 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10367 000007C4 50                      		push	ax
 10368 000007C5 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10369 000007C8 1E                      		push	ds
 10370 000007C9 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10371 000007CD 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10372 000007D0 1F                      		pop	ds
 10373 000007D1 58                      		pop	ax
 10374                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10375 000007D2 9D                      		popf
 10376 000007D3 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10377 000007D5 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10378                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10379                                  
 10380                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10381 000007D7 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10382                                  					; return error
 10383 000007D9 F9                      		stc
 10384                                  
 10385                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10386                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10387                                  
 10388                                  okret2:					
 10389 000007DA 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10390 000007DE 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10391 000007E2 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]

 10397 000007EB 5D                      		pop	bp

 10491                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10492                                  
 10493                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10494                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10495                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10496                                  
 10497                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10498                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10499                                  ;
 10500                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10501                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10502                                  
 10503                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10504                                  checksingle:		
 10505 0000083C 50                      		push	ax
 10506 0000083D 53                      		push	bx
 10507 0000083E 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10508                                  
 10509                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10510                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10511                                  
 10512 00000842 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10513 00000845 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10514 00000847 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10515                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10516 0000084A 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10517                                  
 10518                                  
 10519                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10520                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10521                                  
 10522 0000084C 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10523                                  					; get physical drive number
 10524 00000850 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10525 00000851 57                      		push	di
 10526 00000852 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10527                                  scan_list:				
 10528 00000856 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10529 0000085A 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10530 0000085C B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10531 0000085E 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10532 00000862 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10533 00000864 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10534 00000868 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10535 00000869 07                      		pop	es
 10536 0000086A 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10537                                  
 10538                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10539                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10540                                  ; in this case.
 10541 0000086E 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10542 00000873 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10543                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10544 00000875 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10545 0000087A 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10546 0000087C 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10547                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10548                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10549 00000880 06                      		push	es
 10550 00000881 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10551 00000885 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10552                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10553                                  					; set up sdsb
 10554 00000889 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10555 0000088A EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10556                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10557                                  
 10558                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10559                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10560                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10561                                  
 10562                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10563 0000088C 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10564 00000891 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10565 00000893 50                      		push	ax
 10566 00000894 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10567 00000898 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10568 0000089A 06                      		push	es
 10569 0000089B 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10570 0000089F 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10571                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10572                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10573 000008A4 07                      		pop	es
 10574 000008A5 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10575 000008A7 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10576 000008A8 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10577                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10578 000008AA E8800E                  		call	swpdsk
 10579 000008AD EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10580                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10581                                  
 10582                                  scan_skip:	
 10583 000008AF 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10584                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10585                                  					; go to	next bds
 10586 000008B2 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10587 000008B5 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10588 000008B7 F9                      		stc
 10589 000008B8 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10590 000008B9 07                      		pop	es
 10591                                  
 10592                                  singleret:

 10615                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10616                                  
 10617                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10618                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10619                                  ;
 10620                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10621                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10622                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10623                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10624                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10625                                  ;	ds = cs
 10626                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10627                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10628                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10629                                  ;
 10630                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10631                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10632                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10633                                  
 10634                                  diskrd:	
 10635                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10636                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10637 000008C5 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10638                                  
 10639                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10640                                  
 10641                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10642                                  diskio:
