 13349                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13350                                  
 13351                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13352                                  
 13353                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13354                                  ;
 13355                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13356                                  ;
 13357                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13358                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13359                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13360                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13361                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13362                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13363                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13364                                  ;
 13365                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13366                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13367                                  ;
 13368                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13369                                  
 13370                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13371                                  HMAPtr:
 13372 000013C4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13373                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13374 000013C9 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13375                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13376 000013CD 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13377 000013D0 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13378 000013D2 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13379                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13380 000013D7 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13381 000013D9 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13382                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13383 000013DD 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13384                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13385                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13386 000013E1 C3                      		retn
 13387                                  
 13388                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13389                                  
 13390                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13391                                  
 13392                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13393                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13394                                  
 13395                                  move_sector:
 13396                                  
 13397                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13398                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13399                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13400                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13401                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13402                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13403                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13404                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13405                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13406                                  ;
 13407                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13408                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13409                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13410                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13411                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13412                                  
 13413 000013E2 FC                      		cld
 13414 000013E3 51                      		push	cx
 13415 000013E4 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13416 000013E7 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13417 000013EB 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13418 000013ED 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13419 000013F1 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13420 000013F3 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13421 000013F5 59                      		pop	cx
 13422 000013F6 C3                      		retn
 13423                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13424                                  
 13425                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13426 000013F7 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13427 000013F9 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13428 000013FB 59                      		pop	cx
 13429 000013FC C3                      		retn
 13430                                  
 13431                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13432                                  
 13433                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13434                                  
 13435                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13436                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13437                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13438                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13439                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13440                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13441                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13442                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13443                                  ;
 13444                                  ; input conditions:
 13445                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13446                                  ;
 13447                                  ; output:
 13448                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13449                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13450                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13451                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13452                                  
 13453                                  check_wrap:	
 13454 000013FD 50                      		push	ax
 13455 000013FE 53                      		push	bx
 13456 000013FF 06                      		push	es
 13457 00001400 57                      		push	di
 13458 00001401 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13459 00001404 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13460                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13461 00001406 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13462                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13463 0000140B 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13464 0000140D 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13465 00001411 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13466 00001413 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13467 00001416 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13468 00001418 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13469 0000141A F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13470                                  
 13471                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13472                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13473                                  
 13474 0000141C 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13475 0000141E 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13476                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13477 00001420 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13478 00001421 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13479                                  					; if on	boundary
 13480                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13481                                  not_on_bound:				
 13482 00001423 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13483 00001426 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13484 00001428 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13485 0000142A 40                      		inc	ax
 13486 0000142B 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13487 0000142D 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13488 00001430 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13489                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13490 00001434 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13491 00001436 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13492 00001437 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13493 00001439 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13494 0000143D F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13495                                  
 13496                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13497                                  
 13498 0000143F 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13499 00001441 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13500 00001443 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13501                                  
 13502                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13503                                  
 13504 00001445 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13505 00001447 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13506 00001449 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13507                                  no_head_bound:				
 13508 0000144A 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13509 0000144C 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13510 0000144D FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13511 0000144F 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13512 00001451 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13513 00001453 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13514 00001456 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13515 00001458 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13516 0000145A D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13517 0000145C 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13518 0000145E 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13519 00001460 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13520 00001462 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13521 00001464 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13522                                  no_wrap:				
 13523 00001466 F8                      		clc
 13524 00001467 5F                      		pop	di
 13525 00001468 07                      		pop	es
 13526 00001469 5B                      		pop	bx
 13527 0000146A 58                      		pop	ax
 13528 0000146B C3                      		retn
 13529                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13530                                  
 13531                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13532 0000146C 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13533 0000146E FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13534 00001470 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13535                                  
 13536                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13537                                  
 13538                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13539                                  
 13540                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13541                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13542                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13543                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13544                                  ;
 13545                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13546                                  
 13547                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13548                                  find_bds:	
 13549 00001472 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13550                                  fbds_1:					
 13551 00001476 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13552 0000147A 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13553 0000147C 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13554                                  					; go to next bds
 13555 0000147F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13556 00001482 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13557 00001484 F9                      		stc
 13558                                  fdbs_2:					
 13559 00001485 C3                      		retn
 13560                                  
 13561                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13562                                  
 13563                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13564                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13565                                  doint:
 13566                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13567 00001486 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13568                                  					; get physical drive number
 13569                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13570                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13571                                  		
 13572 00001489 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13573 0000148B 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13574 0000148D 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13575                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13576 0000148F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13577                                  					; get request code
 13578                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13579 00001492 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13580                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13581 00001495 9D                      		popf
 13582                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13583                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13584 00001496 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13585                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13586                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13587 0000149B 9C                      		pushf
 13588                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13589 0000149C 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13590                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13591                                  dointdone:				
 13592 0000149F C3                      		retn
 13593                                  
 13594                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13595                                  
 13596                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13597                                  
 13598                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13599                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13600                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13601                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13602                                  ;
 13603                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13604                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13605                                  ;
 13606                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13607                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13608                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13609                                  
 13610                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13611                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13612                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13613                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13614                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13615                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13616                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13617                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13618                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13619                                  ;end struc
 13620                                  
 13621                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13622                                  
 13623                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13624                                  ;	ah = function
 13625                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13626                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13627                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13628                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13629                                  ;   output conditions:
 13630                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13631                                  
 13632                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13633                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13634                                  ;
 13635                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13636                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13637                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13638                                  
 13639                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13640                                  
 13641                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13642                                  
 13643 000014A0 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13644                                  
 13645                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13646                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13647                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13648                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13649                                  
 13650                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13651                                  
 13652                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13653                                  
 13654                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13655                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13656                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13657                                  
 13658                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13659 000014A4 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13660 000014A9 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13661 000014AB 53                      		push	bx
 13662 000014AC BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13663 000014AF E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13664 000014B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 13665 000014B3 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13666                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13667                                  
 13668                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13669                                  
 13670                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13671                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13672                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13673                                  
 13674                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13675                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13676 000014B5 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13677 000014B7 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13678 000014B9 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13679 000014BA 51                      		push	cx
 13680 000014BB 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13681 000014BD B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13682 000014BF D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13683 000014C1 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13684 000014C5 59                      		pop	cx
 13685 000014C6 58                      		pop	ax
 13686 000014C7 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13687                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13688 000014C9 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13689 000014CA 06                      		push	es
 13690                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13691 000014CB 2EC41E[A014]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13692                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13693                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13694 000014D0 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13695 000014D2 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13696 000014D5 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13697                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13698                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13699 000014D9 07                      		pop	es
 13700 000014DA 5B                      		pop	bx
 13701 000014DB EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13702                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13703                                  
 13704                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13705                                  
 13706                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13707                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13708                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13709                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13710                                  
 13711                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13712 000014DD 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13713                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13714 000014E2 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13715 000014E4 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13716                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13717 000014E9 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13718                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13719 000014EB 50                      		push	ax
 13720 000014EC B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13721                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13722                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13723 000014EE 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13724                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13725                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13726 000014F3 58                      		pop	ax
 13727 000014F4 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13728                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13729                                  
 13730                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13731                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13732                                  
 13733                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13734                                  
 13735                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13736                                  
 13737                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13738                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13739                                  
 13740                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13741 000014F6 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13742                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13743                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13744 000014F7 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13745                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13746                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13747                                  
 13748                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13749                                  
 13750 000014FC A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13751 000014FF 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13752 00001502 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13753                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13754                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13755 00001504 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13756 00001509 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13757                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13758                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13759                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13760 0000150B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13761                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13762                                  		
 13763 00001510 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13764                                  		
 13765 00001511 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13766                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13767 00001516 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13768                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13769                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13770 00001518 9D                      		popf
 13771 00001519 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13772                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13773 0000151B 1F                      		pop	ds
 13774 0000151C CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13775                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13776                                  
 13777                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13778                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13779                                  ; a changeline error.
 13780                                  
 13781                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13782 0000151F 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13783                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13784 00001521 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13785 00001524 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13786 00001526 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13787 00001528 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13788 0000152A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13789 0000152F 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13790                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13791                                  					; never	would
 13792 00001531 53                      		push	bx
 13793 00001532 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13794 00001535 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13795 00001538 5B                      		pop	bx
 13796                                  int13b:					
 13797 00001539 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13798 0000153A EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13799                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13800                                  
 13801                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13802                                  
 13803                                  goterr13:				
 13804 0000153C 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13805 0000153F 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13806                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13807 00001541 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13808 00001544 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13809 00001546 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13810 0000154B 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13811                                  
 13812 0000154D 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13813                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13814                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13815                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13816 00001552 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13817                                  
 13818 00001554 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13819                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13820                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13821 00001556 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13822                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13823                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13824 0000155B A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13825 0000155E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13826 00001560 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13827 00001562 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13828 00001564 53                      		push	bx
 13829 00001565 51                      		push	cx
 13830 00001566 52                      		push	dx
 13831 00001567 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13832                                  loop_ecc:				
 13833 0000156A B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13834                                  
 13835                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13836                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13837                                  ;
 13838                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13839                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13840                                  ; track.
 13841                                  ;
 13842                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13843                                  ; this request.
 13844                                  ;
 13845                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13846                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13847                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13848                                  ;
 13849 0000156D E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13850                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13851                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13852 00001570 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13853                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13854 00001575 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13855 00001577 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13856 0000157A 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13857 0000157C 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13858 0000157F 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13859                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13860                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13861                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13862 00001581 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13863                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13864                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13865                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13866                                  ok11_op:				
 13867 00001583 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13868 00001587 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13869 00001589 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13870                                  					; add 200h to address
 13871 0000158B FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13872 0000158D FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13873 0000158F EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13874                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13875                                  
 13876                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13877                                  
 13878                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13879 00001591 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13880                                  ok11_exit:				
 13881 00001592 5A                      		pop	dx
 13882 00001593 59                      		pop	cx
 13883 00001594 5B                      		pop	bx
 13884 00001595 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13885                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13886                                  
 13887                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13888                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13889                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13890                                  
 13891                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13892 00001597 06                      		push	es
 13893 00001598 53                      		push	bx
 13894 00001599 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13895 0000159C 1E                      		push	ds
 13896 0000159D 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13897 0000159E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13898                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13899                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13900 000015A1 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13901                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13902 000015A6 5B                      		pop	bx
 13903 000015A7 07                      		pop	es
 13904 000015A8 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13905 000015AA 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13906 000015AD 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13907                                  
 13908                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13909                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13910                                  
 13911                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13912 000015AF 56                      		push	si
 13913 000015B0 57                      		push	di
 13914 000015B1 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13915 000015B3 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13916 000015B6 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13917 000015B9 5F                      		pop	di
 13918 000015BA 5E                      		pop	si
 13919 000015BB EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13920                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13921                                  
 13922                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13923                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13924                                  
 13925                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13926 000015BD A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13927 000015C0 FB                      		sti
 13928 000015C1 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13929 000015C4 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13930                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13931                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13932 000015C6 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13933 000015C9 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13934 000015CB 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13935 000015CE 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13936 000015D0 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13937                                  
 13938                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13939                                  
 13940                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13941                                  
 13942 000015D2 52                      		push	dx
 13943 000015D3 51                      		push	cx
 13944 000015D4 53                      		push	bx
 13945 000015D5 50                      		push	ax
 13946 000015D6 55                      		push	bp
 13947 000015D7 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13948 000015D9 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13949 000015DB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13950 000015DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13951 000015DF D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13952 000015E1 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13953 000015E3 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13954 000015E5 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13955                                  
 13956                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13957                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13958                                  
 13959 000015E9 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13960 000015EB E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13961                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13962                                  
 13963                                  no_skip_first:				
 13964 000015EE D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13965 000015F0 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13966 000015F2 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13967                                  
 13968                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13969                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13970                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13971                                  ;
 13972                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13973                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13974                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13975                                  ; in error.
 13976                                  
 13977 000015F4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13978 000015F6 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13979                                  
 13980                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13981                                  
 13982 000015F8 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13983                                  					; set up head number
 13984 000015FB E888FE                  		call	doint
 13985 000015FE E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13986                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13987                                  
 13988                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13989 00001601 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13990 00001603 F9                      		stc
 13991 00001604 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13992                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13993                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13994                                  
 13995                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13996                                  
 13997                                  intverify:				
 13998 00001607 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13999 00001608 53                      		push	bx
 14000 00001609 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14001 0000160A 07                      		pop	es
 14002                                  dosimple:				
 14003 0000160B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14004                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14005                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14006                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14007 0000160E 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14008                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14009 00001613 5B                      		pop	bx
 14010 00001614 07                      		pop	es
 14011 00001615 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14012                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14013                                  
 14014                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14015                                  
 14016                                  intformat:				
 14017 00001618 06                      		push	es
 14018 00001619 53                      		push	bx
 14019 0000161A 56                      		push	si
 14020 0000161B 57                      		push	di
 14021 0000161C 1E                      		push	ds
 14022                                  
 14023                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14024                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14025                                  
 14026 0000161D 06                      		push	es
 14027 0000161E 1E                      		push	ds
 14028 0000161F 07                      		pop	es
 14029 00001620 1F                      		pop	ds
 14030 00001621 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14031 00001623 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14032 00001626 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14033 00001629 1F                      		pop	ds
 14034 0000162A 5F                      		pop	di
 14035 0000162B 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14036 0000162C EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14037                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14038                                  
 14039                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14040                                  ; the first block.
 14041                                  ;
 14042                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14043                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14044                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14045                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14046                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14047                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14048                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14049                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14050                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14051                                  
 14052                                  doblock:
 14053                                  
 14054                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14055                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14056                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14057                                  				
 14058 0000162E 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14059                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14060 00001631 51                      		push	cx
 14061 00001632 06                      		push	es
 14062 00001633 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14063                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14064 00001634 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14065 00001637 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14066                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14067 0000163B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14068                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14069 00001640 5F                      		pop	di
 14070 00001641 07                      		pop	es
 14071 00001642 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14072 00001644 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14073 00001646 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14074 00001648 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14075                                  doblockflop:				
 14076 0000164A 59                      		pop	cx
 14077                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14078 0000164B 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14079 0000164D 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14080 0000164F 50                      		push	ax
 14081 00001650 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14082 00001652 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14083                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14084                                  
 14085                                  doblocklast:				
 14086 00001654 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14087 00001656 50                      		push	ax
 14088                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14089 00001657 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14090 0000165A 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14091 0000165C 58                      		pop	ax
 14092 0000165D 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14093                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14094 00001660 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14095 00001662 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14096 00001664 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14097 00001666 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14098 00001668 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14099                                  					; then we are done already.
 14100 0000166A 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14101                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14102 0000166C E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14103 0000166F EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14104                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14105                                  
 14106                                  bufferx:				
 14107 00001671 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14108                                  					; set up head number
 14109                                  buffer:					
 14110 00001674 53                      		push	bx
 14111 00001675 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14112 00001678 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14113 0000167B 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14114                                  					
 14115                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14116                                  
 14117 0000167D 06                      		push	es
 14118 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds
 14119 0000167F 56                      		push	si
 14120 00001680 57                      		push	di
 14121 00001681 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14122 00001682 06                      		push	es
 14123 00001683 1F                      		pop	ds
 14124 00001684 07                      		pop	es
 14125 00001685 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14126 00001688 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14127 00001689 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14128 0000168B E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14129 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14130                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14131 0000168F 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14132 00001690 5E                      		pop	si
 14133 00001691 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14134                                  
 14135                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14136                                  
 14137 00001692 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14138                                  					; get drive number
 14139 00001694 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14140 00001697 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14141                                  					;
 14142                                  					; ah is	function
 14143                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14144                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14145                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14146                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14147                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14148 0000169A E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14149 0000169D 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14150 0000169E 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14151 000016A0 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14152                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14153                                  
 14154                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14155                                  
 14156                                  doread:					
 14157 000016A2 06                      		push	es
 14158 000016A3 53                      		push	bx
 14159 000016A4 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14160 000016A5 07                      		pop	es
 14161 000016A6 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14162 000016A9 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14163 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14164                                  					; get drive number
 14165 000016AE E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14166                                  					; ah = function
 14167                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14168                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14169                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14170 000016B1 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14171 000016B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 14172 000016B5 07                      		pop	es
 14173 000016B6 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14174 000016B8 56                      		push	si
 14175 000016B9 57                      		push	di
 14176 000016BA 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14177 000016BC BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14178 000016BF E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 14179 000016C2 5F                      		pop	di
 14180 000016C3 5E                      		pop	si
 14181                                  
 14182                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14183                                  
 14184                                  dotail:					
 14185 000016C4 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14186 000016C5 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14187 000016C8 41                      		inc	cx
 14188 000016C9 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14189 000016CC F8                      		clc
 14190 000016CD FEC8                    		dec	al
 14191 000016CF 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14192                                  
 14193                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14194                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14195                                  
 14196 000016D1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14197 000016D4 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14198 000016D7 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14199                                  
 14200                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14201                                  
 14202                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14203                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14204                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14205                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14206                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14207                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14208                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14209                                  
 14210                                  bad13:					
 14211 000016DA 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14212 000016DC 5D                      		pop	bp
 14213 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14214 000016DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 14215 000016DF 59                      		pop	cx
 14216 000016E0 5A                      		pop	dx
 14217 000016E1 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14218 000016E3 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14219                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14220                                  
 14221                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14222 000016E6 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14223                                  
 14224                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14225                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14226                                  		;db 	0
 14227                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14228                                  
 14229                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14230                                  
 14231                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 14239                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14240 000016E9 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14241 000016ED BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14242 000016F0 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14243 000016F1 07                      		pop	es
 14244 000016F2 E9C3EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14245                                  
 14246                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14247                                  
 14248                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14249                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14250                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14251                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14252                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14253                                  
 14254                                  install_bds:		
 14255 000016F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14256 000016F6 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14257                                  
 14258                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14259                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14260                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14261 000016F9 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14262                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14263 000016FB 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14264 000016FF 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14265                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14266 00001702 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14267 00001704 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14268 00001706 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14269                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14270 0000170A 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14271 0000170D 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14272                                  					; we don't own it
 14273 00001712 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14274                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14275 00001715 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14276 00001718 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14277                                  next_bds:				
 14278 0000171C 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14279                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14280 0000171F 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14281 00001721 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14282                                  					; install bds
 14283 00001724 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14284 00001726 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14285                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14286 0000172B 1F                      		pop	ds
 14287                                  
 14288                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14289                                  ;
 14290                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14291                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14292                                  ;
 14293                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14294                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14295                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14296                                  ;
 14297                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14298                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14299                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14300                                  
 14301 0000172C C3                      		retn
 14302                                  
 14303                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14304

 14308                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14309                                  DRVLET equ drvlet
 14310                                  SNGMSG equ sngmsg
 14311

 14313                                  
 14314                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14315                                  ;  ask to swap the disk in drive a:
 14316                                  ;	es:di -> bds
 14317                                  ;	ds -> Bios_Data
 14318                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14319                                  
 14320                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14321 0000172D F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14322                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14323 00001732 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14324                                  		
 14325                                  		; set focus to the correct VM
 14326                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah
 14327                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14328 00001734 9A[CF08]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14329                                  		;call	far ptr	V86_Crit_SetFocus ; call far 70h:8D1h
 14330                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14331                                  no_win386:				
 14332 00001739 51                      		push	cx
 14333 0000173A 52                      		push	dx
 14334 0000173B 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14335                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14336                                  
 14337                                  ; WARNING : next two instructions assume that if the new disk is for drive B
 14338                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
 14339                                  
 14340 0000173F 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14341 00001741 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14342 00001744 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14343 00001746 B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 14344                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 14345                                  					; Broadcast it
 14346 00001749 CD2F                    		int	2Fh	
 14347 0000174B 41                      		inc	cx		; cx == -1 ?
 14348 0000174C 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 14349                                  
 14350                                  ; using a different drive in a one drive system so request the user change disks
 14351                                  
 14352 0000174E 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'
 14353                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14354 00001751 2E8816[8B17]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl
 14355                                  		; 16/10/2022
 14356                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:drvlet], dl
 14357                                  		;mov	byte ptr cs:17E4h, dl ; [cs:drvlet]
 14358                                  					; 0070h:3D54h =	2C7h:17E4h
 14359 00001756 BE[6F17]                		mov	si, SNGMSG
 14360                                  		;mov	si, 17C8h	; sngmsg
 14361                                  					; 0070h:3D38h =	2C7h:17C8h
 14362 00001759 53                      		push	bx
 14363 0000175A 2E                      		cs
 14364 0000175B AC                      		lodsb			; get the next character of the message
 14365                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14366                                  wrmsg_loop:				
 14367 0000175C CD29                    		int	29h		; DOS 2+ internal - FAST PUTCHAR
 14368                                  					; AL = character to display
 14369 0000175E 2E                      		cs
 14370 0000175F AC                      		lodsb
 14371                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
 14372                                  					; get the next character of the	message
 14373 00001760 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14374 00001762 75F8                    		jnz	short wrmsg_loop
 14375 00001764 E8A0EA                  		call	con_flush	; flush out keyboard queue
 14376                                  					; call rom-bios
 14377 00001767 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14378 00001769 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
 14379                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
 14380 0000176B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14381                                  swpdsk9:

 14383 0000176D 59                      		pop	cx
 14384 0000176E C3                      		retn
