 15221                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15222                                  
 15223                                  section .SYSINIT vstart=0
 15224                                  
 15225                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15226                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15227                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15228                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 31/12/2022))
 15229                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15230                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15231                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15232                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15233                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15234                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit5.s -l sysinit5.lst -o SYSINIT5.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15235                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15236                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15237                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15238                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15239                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15240                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15241                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15242                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15243                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15244                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15245                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15246                                  
 15247                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15248                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15249                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15250                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15251                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15252                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15253                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15254                                  
 15255                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15256                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15257                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15258                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15259                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15260                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15261                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15262                                  ;
 15263                                  ;
 15264                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15265                                  ;
 15266                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15267                                  ;
 15268                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15269                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15270                                  ;
 15271                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15272                                  ;
 15273                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15274                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15275                                  ;
 15276                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15277                                  ;
 15278                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15279                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15280                                  ;value.
 15281                                  ;
 15282                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15283                                  ;
 15284                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15285                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15286                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15287                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15288                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15289                                  ;
 15290                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15291                                  ;
 15292                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15293                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15294                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15295                                  ;
 15296                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15297                                  ;
 15298                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15299                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15300                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15301                                  ;
 15302                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15303                                  ;
 15304                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15305                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15306                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15307                                  ;
 15308                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15309                                  ;
 15310                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15311                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15312                                  ;
 15313                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15314                                  ;
 15315                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15316                                  ;
 15317                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15318                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15319                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15320                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15321                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15322                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15323                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15324                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15325                                  ;memory.
 15326                                  ;NOTES:
 15327                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15328                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15329                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15330                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15331                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15332                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15333                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15334                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15335                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15336                                  
 15337                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15338                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15339                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15340                                  
 15341                                  ;include version.inc
 15342                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15343                                  
 15344                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15345                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15346                                  
 15347                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15348                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15349                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15350                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15351                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15352                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15353                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15354                                  
 15355                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15356                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15357                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15358                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15359                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15360                                  
 15361                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15362                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15363                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15364                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15365                                  
 15366                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15367                                  
 15368                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15369                                  				; currently 0.
 15370                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15371                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15372                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15373                                  
 15374                                  ;      if1
 15375                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15376                                  ;      endif
 15377                                  
 15378                                         ;******************************
 15379                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15380                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15381                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15382                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15383                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15384                                         ;******************************
 15385                                  
 15386                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15387                                  ; device definitions
 15388                                  
 15389                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15390                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15391                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15392                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15393                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15394                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15395                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15396                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15397                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15398                                  
 15399                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15400                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15401 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15402 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15403 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15404 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15405 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15406                                  .size:
 15407                                  endstruc
 15408                                  
 15409                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15410                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15411 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15412 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15413 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15414 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15415 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15416                                  .size:
 15417                                  endstruc
 15418                                  
 15419                                  ;Status word masks
 15420                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15421                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15422                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15423                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15424                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15425                                  
 15426                                  ;Function codes
 15427                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15428                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15429                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15430                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15431                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15432                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15433                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15434                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15435                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15436                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15437                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15438                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15439                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15440                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15441                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15442                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15443                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15444                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15445                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15446                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15447                                  
 15448                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15449                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15450 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15451 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15452 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15453 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15454 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15455 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15456                                                          ; word
 15457 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15458 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15459 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15460 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15461                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15462                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15463                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15464                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15465                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15466                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15467                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15468                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15469 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15470 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15471 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15472 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15473 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15474 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15475                                  .size:
 15476                                  endstruc
 15477                                  
 15478                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15479                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15480                                  
 15481                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15482                                  
 15483                                  struc buffinfo
 15484 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15485 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15486 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15487                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15488                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15489 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15490                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15491                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15492                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15493                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15494                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15495                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15496                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15497                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15498 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15499                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15500 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15501 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15502 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15503 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15504 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15505                                  .size:
 15506                                  endstruc
 15507                                  
 15508                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15509                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15510                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15511                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15512                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15513                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15514                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15515                                  
 15516                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15517                                  
 15518                                  
 15519                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15520                                  
 15521                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15522                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15523                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15524                                  ;***
 15525                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15526                                  ;***
 15527                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15528                                  
 15529                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15530                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15531                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15532                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15533                                  
 15534                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 15535                                  
 15536                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15537                                  
 15538                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15539                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15540                                  
 15541                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15542                                  
 15543                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15544                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15545                                  ;
 15546                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15547                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15548                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15549                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15550                                  ;
 15551                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15552                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15553                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15554                                  
 15555                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15556                                  
 15557                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15558                                  
 15559                                  struc	DPB
 15560 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15561 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15562 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15563 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15564 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15565 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15566 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15567 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15568 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15569 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15570                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15571 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15572 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15573 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15574 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15575 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15576                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used

 15642                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15643                                  
 15644                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15645                                  ;
 15646                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15647                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15648                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15649                                  ;
 15650                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15651                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15652                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15653                                  ;
 15654                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15655                                  
 15656                                  struc A_BPB
 15657 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15658 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15659 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15660 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15661 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15662 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15663 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15664 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15665 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15666 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15667 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15668 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15669 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15670 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15671 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15672                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15673                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15674                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15675                                  .size:
 15676                                  endstruc
 15677

 15935                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15936                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15937                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15938                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15939                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15940                                  									  
 15941                                  ;*******************************					  
 15942                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15943                                  ;*******************************					  
 15944                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15945                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15946                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15947                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15948                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15949                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15950                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15951                                  ;For all others:							  
 15952                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15953                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15954                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15955                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15956                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15957                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15958                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15959                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15960                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15961                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15962                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15963                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15964                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15965                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15966                                  ;									  
 15967                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15968                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15969                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15970                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15971                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15972                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15973                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15974                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15975                                  ;									  
 15976                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15977                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15978                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15979                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15980                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15981                                  ;									  
 15982                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15983                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15984                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15985                                  ;									  
 15986                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15987                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15988                                  ;									  
 15989                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15990                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15991                                  ;									  
 15992                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15993                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15994                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15995                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15996                                  ;						called. 		  
 15997                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15998                                  ;									  
 15999                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16000                                  ;									  
 16001                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16002                                  ;									  
 16003                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16004                                  ;									  
 16005                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16006                                  ;									  
 16007                                  
 16008                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16009                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16010 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16011 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16012                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16013 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16014 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16015 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16016 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16017                                  endstruc					  
 16018                                  									  
 16019                                  ;FeatureByte1	bit map equates 					  
 16020                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 16021                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 16022                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 16023                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 16024                                  					;;End of Modification
 16025

 16027                                  ; SYSVAR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16028                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16029                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16030                                  
 16031                                  ;	SCCSID = @(#)sysvar.asm 1.1 85/04/10
 16032                                  
 16033                                  struc SysInitVars
 16034                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16035 00000000 ????????                .SYSI_DPB:    resd 1			; DPB chain
 16036 00000004 ????????                .SYSI_SFT:    resd 1			; SFT chain
 16037 00000008 ????????                .SYSI_CLOCK:  resd 1			; CLOCK device

 16126                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16127                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16128                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16129                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16130                                  
 16131                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16132                                  ;
 16133                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16134                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16135                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16136                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16137                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16138                                  ;
 16139                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16140                                  ;
 16141                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16142                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16143                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16144                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16145                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16146                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16147                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16148                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16149                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16150                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16151                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16152                                  
 16153                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16154                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16155                                  
 16156                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16157                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16158 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16159 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16160 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16161 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16162 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16163 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16164                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16165 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16166 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16167 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16168                                  .size:
 16169                                  endstruc
 16170                                  
 16171                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16172                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16173                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16174                                  						; argument
 16175                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 16176                                  
 16177                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 16178                                  
 16179                                  ;Flag word masks
 16180                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16181                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16182                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 16183                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 16184                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B
 16185                                  
 16186                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16187                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16188                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16189                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16190                                  
 16191                                  ; system file table
 16192                                  
 16193                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16194                                  ;
 16195                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16196                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16197                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16198                                  
 16199                                  struc	SF
 16200 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16201 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16202 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16203                                  .size:
 16204                                  endstruc
 16205                                  
 16206                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16207                                  ;
 16208                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16209                                  
 16210                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16211 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16212                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16213 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16214 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16215 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16216                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16217                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16218                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16219                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16220                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16221                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16222                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16223                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16224                                  					;
 16225                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16226                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16227                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16228                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16229                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16230                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16231                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16232                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16233                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16234                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16235                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16236                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16237 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16238                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16239                                  					; points to net device header if
 16240                                  					; remote
 16241 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16242                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16243 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16244 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16245 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16246 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16247                                  ;
 16248                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16249                                  ; ID
 16250                                  ;
 16251 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16252 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16253 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 16254                                  ;
 16255                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 16256                                  ;
 16257 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 16258                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 16259                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 16260                                  					; disk changed errors.
 16261                                  ; SHARING INFO
 16262 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 16263 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 16264 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 16265 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 16266 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 16267 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 16268                                  .size:
 16269                                  endstruc
 16270

 16482                                  ; SYSINIT1.ASM (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991)

 16548                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16549                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16550                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16551                                  
 16552                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16553                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16554                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16555                                  
 16556                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16557                                  ;
 16558                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16559                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16560                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16561                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16562                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16563                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16564                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16565                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16566                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16567                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16568                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16569                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16570                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16571                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16572                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16573                                  ;
 16574                                  
 16575                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16576                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16577                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16578                                  ;
 16579                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16580                                  ;
 16581                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16582                                  ;
 16583                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16584                                  ;
 16585                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16586                                  ;
 16587                                  
 16588                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16589                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16590                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16591                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16592                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16593                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16594                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16595                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16596                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16597                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16598                                  
 16599                                  		;EVEN
 16600                                  ;align 2
 16601                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16602                                  
 16603 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16604 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16605 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16606 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16607 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16608 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16609                                  
 16610 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16611 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16612 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16613                                  
 16614                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16615                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16616                                  
 16617                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16618                                  
 16619 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16620                                  
 16621                                  int02:
 16622                                  
 16623                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16624                                  ;
 16625                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16626                                  ;
 16627                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16628                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16629                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16630                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16631                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16632                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16633                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16634                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16635                                  ;
 16636                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16637                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16638                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16639                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16640                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16641                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16642                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16643                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16644                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16645                                  ;
 16646                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16647                                  
 16648 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16649 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16650 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16651 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16652                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16653 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16654 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16655 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16656                                  
 16657 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16658                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16659                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16660                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16661                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16662 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16663 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02

 16900                                  ;********************************************************************
 16901                                  
 16902                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16903                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16904                                  ; service routine
 16905                                  
 16906                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16907                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16908                                  
 16909                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16910                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16911                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16912                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16913                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16914                                  
 16915                                  do_int_stacks:
 16916 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16917 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16918 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16919 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16920 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16921 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16922                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16923                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16924                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16925 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16926 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16927 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16928                                  
 16929 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16930                                  
 16931                                  found02:
 16932 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16933 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16934                                  
 16935 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16936                                  
 16937 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16938                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16939                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16940                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16941                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16942 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16943 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16944                                  
 16945                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16946                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16947                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16948                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16949                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16950                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16951                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16952                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16953                                  
 16954                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16955 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16956 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16957 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16958 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16959 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16960 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16961 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16962 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16963                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16964                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16965 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16966                                  
 16967 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16968                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16969 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16970                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16971                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16972                                  
 16973 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16974                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16975 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16976                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16977                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16978 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16979 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16980                                  
 16981                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16982                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16983                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16984 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16985 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16986                                  
 16987 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16988 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16989 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16990 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16991 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16992                                  
 16993                                  notfree02:
 16994 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16995 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16996                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16997                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16998                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16999 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17000                                  
 17001                                  findnext02:
 17002 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17003 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 17004                                  
 17005                                  foundbad02:
 17006 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17007 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17008 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17009                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17010                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17011                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17012 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17013 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17014

 17017                                  ; Common routines
 17018                                  
 17019                                  longpath:
 17020                                  	; 21/03/2019
 17021 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 17022                                  lploopp:
 17023                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17024                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 17025                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17026 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free

 17437                                  ; set fake_floppy_drv if there is no diskette drives in this machine.
 17438                                  ; execute the equipment determination interrupt and then
 17439                                  ; check the returned value to see if we have any floppy drives

 17441                                  ; see the at tech ref bios listings for help on the equipment

 17452                                  
 17453                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
 17454                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
 17455                                  ;
 17456                                  ; WARNING !!!
 17457                                  ;
 17458                                  ; This sequence of code is present in MSINIT.ASM also. Any modification
 17459                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in MSINIT.ASM also
 17460                                  
 17461 000004B5 06                      	push	es
 17462                                  
 17463 000004B6 30C9                    	xor	cl,cl	
 17464 000004B8 B408                    	mov	ah,8			; get disk parameters
 17465 000004BA B200                    	mov	dl,0			; of drive 0
 17466 000004BC CD13                    	int	13h
 17467                                  
 17468 000004BE 07                      	pop	es
 17469                                  
 17470 000004BF 720F                    	jc	short move_myself	; if error lets assume that the
 17471                                  					;  ROM BIOS lied
 17472 000004C1 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; double check (max sec no cannot be 0)

 18259                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18260                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18261                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18262                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18263                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18264                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18265                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18266                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18267                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18268                                  ;
 18269                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18270                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18271                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18272                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18273                                  ; been patched.
 18274                                  
 18275                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0

 18559 000007D6 BA[C934]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18560                                  
 18561                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18562                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18563                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18564                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18565                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18566                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18567                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18568                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18569                                  
 18570                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18571                                  
 18572 000007D9 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18573 000007DA BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 18576 000007E1 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18577 000007E3 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18578 000007E5 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18579                                  
 18580 000007E7 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18581 000007E9 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC

 18583 000007ED 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18584                                  
 18585                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18586                                  
 18587                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18588                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18589                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18590                                  
 18591                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18592                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 18594 000007F3 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18595                                  
 18596                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18597                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18598                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18599                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18600                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18601                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18602                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18603                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18604                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18605                                  ;
 18606                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18607                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18608                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18609                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18610                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18611                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18612                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18613                                  
 18614                                  	; 22/10/2022

 18858                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18859                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 18860                                  ;
 18861                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18862                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 18863                                  ;
 18864                                  ; Inputs : None
 18865                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 18866                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 18867                                  ;	   free memory.
 18868                                  ;
 18869                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 18870                                  ;
 18871                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 18897                                  ; procedure : LoadDOSHiOrLo
 18898                                  ;
 18899                                  ;		Tries to move DOS into HMA. If it fails then loads
 18900                                  ;		DOS into Low memory. For ROMDOS, nothing is actually
 18901                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 18902                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.
 18903                                  ;
 18904                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 18912                                  	;retn
 18913                                  	; 18/12/2022

 18926                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.

 18954                                  ;
 18955                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18956                                  ;
 18957                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18958                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18959                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18960                                  ;
 18961                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18962                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18963                                  ; 
 18964                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18965                                  
 18966                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18967                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 18968                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 18969                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18970                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18971                                  	; ds = cs
 18972 000008D6 E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 18973 000008D9 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 18974                                  
 18975                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18976                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18977                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 18978                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18979                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18980                                  	; ds = cs
 18981 000008DB 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 18982                                  ;else
 18983                                  ;	..
 18984                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18985                                  
 18986                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18987                                  	; ds = cs
 18988 000008DF 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 18989                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 18990 000008E1 FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 18991                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 18992 000008E5 C606[6A02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 18993 000008EA F8                      	clc
 18994                                  ttldhx:
 18995 000008EB C3                      	retn

 18999                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19000                                  ;
 19001                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19002                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19003                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19004                                  ;
 19005                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed

 19007                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19008

 19029

 19033
