 19373                                  
 19374                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19375                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19376                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19377                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19378                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19379                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19380                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19381                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19382                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19383                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19384                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19385                                  ;
 19386                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19387                                  
 19388                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19389                                  update_arena:
 19390 0000097F 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19391 00000980 57                      	push	di
 19392 00000981 51                      	push	cx
 19393 00000982 52                      	push	dx
 19394                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19395                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19396                                  	; 11/12/2022

 19451                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19452                                  ;
 19453                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19454                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19455                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19456                                  ;
 19457                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19458                                  ;
 19459                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 19461                                  AllocHMA:

 19463                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19464                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19465                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low

 19620                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19621                                  ;
 19622                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19623                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19624                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19625                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19626                                  ;
 19627                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19628                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19629                                  ;
 19630                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19631                                  
 19632                                  StartVDHead:
 19633                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19634                                  
 19635 00000A3E 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19636 00000A42 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19637 00000A44 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19638 00000A46 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19639 00000A48 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19640                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19641 00000A49 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19642                                  VDiskSig1:
 19643 00000A50 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19644                                  
 19645                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19646                                  
 19647 00000A55 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19648                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19649 00000A5B 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19650 00000A6A 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19651 00000A6C 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19652                                  VDInt19:
 19653 00000A6D EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19654                                  OldVDInt19:
 19655 00000A6E 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19656                                  
 19657                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19658                                  
 19659                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19660 00000A72 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19661                                  VDiskSig2:
 19662 00000A75 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19663                                  
 19664                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19665                                  
 19666 00000A7A 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19667 00000A7D 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19668 00000A7F 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19669 00000A80 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19670 00000A82 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19671 00000A83 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19672 00000A85 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19673 00000A87 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19674 00000A88 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19675 00000A8A 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19676 00000A8C 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19677 00000A8E 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19678 00000A90 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19679                                  
 19680                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 19684                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader

 19688                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0

 19815                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIt1.ASM)
 19816                                  
 19817                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19818                                  
 19819                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19820                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19821                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19822                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19823                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19824                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19825                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19826                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19827                                  ;								      ;I070
 19828                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19829                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19830                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19831                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19832                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19833                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19834                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19835                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19836                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19837                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19838                                  ;								      ;I070
 19839                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19840                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19841                                  
 19842                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19843                                  	; ds = cs
 19844                                  
 19845 00000B3C 06                      	push	es
 19846 00000B3D 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 19847 00000B3F 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 19848 00000B41 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 19849 00000B43 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 19850 00000B45 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19851 00000B47 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19852 00000B49 05[1C0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 19853 00000B4C 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 19854                                  
 19855                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 19856                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 19857                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax

 19859                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl

 19864 00000B52 8816[000B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl

 19872                                  			; CX = number of words to move

 19879                                  ;
 19880                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19881                                  ;
 19882                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19883                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19884                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19885                                  ;		the offset.
 19886                                  ;

 19915                                  ;
 19916                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary

 19949                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19950                                  ;
 19951                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 19952                                  ;
 19953                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 19954                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 19955                                  ;
 19956                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19957                                  
 19958                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19959                                  CPMHack:
 19960 00000BB0 1E                      	push	ds
 19961 00000BB1 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 19962 00000BB4 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 19963                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 19964                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19965 00000BB6 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 19966 00000BB7 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 19967 00000BB9 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 19968 00000BBC BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 19969                                  	;mov	cx,5
 19970 00000BBF B105                    	mov	cl,5
 19971 00000BC1 FC                      	cld
 19972 00000BC2 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 19973 00000BC4 1F                      	pop	ds
 19974 00000BC5 C3                      	retn

 20838                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20839                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20840                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20841                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20842                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20843                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20844                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20845                                  ;
 20846                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20847                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20848                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20849                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20850                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20851                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20852                                  ;
 20853                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20854                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20855                                  ;
 20856                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20857                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20858                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20859                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20860                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20861                                  ;
 20862                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20863                                  ;
 20864                                  ;			  none.
 20865                                  
 20866                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20867                                  ;
 20868                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20869                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20870                                  
 20871                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20872                                  
 20873 00000F51 50                      	push	ax

 21073                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21074                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21075                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21076                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21077                                  ;
 21078                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21079                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21080                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21081                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21082                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21083                                  ; program).
 21084                                  
 21085                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21086                                  
 21087                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21088                                  
 21089 00001039 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21090                                  
 21091                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21092                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21093                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21094                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21095                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21096                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21097                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21098                                  ; carridge return.
 21099                                  
 21100                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21101                                  ;character after =.
 21102                                  
 21103 0000103A 06                      	push	es
 21104 0000103B 1E                      	push	ds
 21105 0000103C 07                      	pop	es
 21106 0000103D 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21107 0000103E 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21108                                  
 21109 00001040 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21110 00001042 FC                      	cld
 21111 00001043 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21112 00001049 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21113                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21114 0000104C AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21115 0000104D 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21116 0000104F 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21117 00001051 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21118                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21119 00001053 AC                      	lodsb
 21120 00001054 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21121 00001057 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21122 00001059 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21123 0000105B FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21124 0000105D 47                      	inc	di
 21125 0000105E EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21126                                  done_installparm:
 21127 00001060 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21128 00001065 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21129 00001068 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21130 0000106A 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21131                                  					; starts with cr.
 21132                                  install_seg_set:
 21133 00001070 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21134 00001077 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.

 21222                                  
 21223                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21224                                  ;
 21225                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21226                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21227                                  ;
 21228                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21229                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21230                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21231                                  
 21232                                  ParaRound:
 21233 000010B9 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21234 000010BC D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21235 000010BE D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21236 000010C0 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21237 000010C2 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21238 000010C4 C3                      	retn
 21239                                  
 21240                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21241                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21242                                  ;
 21243                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21244                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21245                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21246                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21247                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21248                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21249                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21250                                  ;
 21251                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21252                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21253                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21254                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21255                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21256                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21257                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21258                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21259                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21260                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21261                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21262                                  ;
 21263                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21264                                  
 21265                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21266                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21267                                  sysinit_base:				
 21268 000010C5 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21269 000010CA 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21270 000010CF CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21271 000010D1 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21272 000010D6 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21273 000010DB 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21274 000010DC 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21275 000010DD 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21276                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21277                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21278 000010DF E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21279 000010E2 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21280 000010E7 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21281                                  
 21282                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21283                                  
 21284 000010E9 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21285 000010EB 0E                      	push	cs
 21286 000010EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 21287 000010ED BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21288 000010F0 CD21                    	int	21h
 21289                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21290                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21291                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21292                                  _stall: 
 21293                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21294 000010F2 F4                      	hlt 
 21295                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21296                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21297 000010F3 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21298                                  
 21299                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21300 000010F5 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21301                                  
 21302                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21303                                  
 21304                                  sum_up:
 21305                                  
 21306                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21307                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21308                                  ;
 21309                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21310                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21311                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21312                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21313                                  ;
 21314                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21315                                  
 21316 000010FA 1E                      	push	ds
 21317                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21318                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21319 000010FB 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21320 000010FF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21321 00001101 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21322 00001103 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21323 00001105 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21324                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21325 0000110A D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21326 0000110C 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21327                                  sum1:
 21328 0000110E 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21329 00001110 46                      	inc	si
 21330 00001111 46                      	inc	si
 21331 00001112 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21332                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21333                                  sum_sys_code:
 21334                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21335 00001114 BE1411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21336                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21337                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21338                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21339                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21340                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21341                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21342                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21343 00001117 B9[6039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21344 0000111A 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21345 0000111C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21346                                  sum2:
 21347 0000111E 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21348 00001121 46                      	inc	si
 21349 00001122 46                      	inc	si
 21350 00001123 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21351 00001125 1F                      	pop	ds
 21352 00001126 C3                      	retn
 21353                                  
 21354                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21355                                  
 21356                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21357                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21358 00001127 0000                    	dw	0
 21359                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21360                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21361 00001129 0000                    	dw	0

 21369 0000112D 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 21369 00001136 6C6F636174696F6E20-

 21384                                  ;

 21448                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21449                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21450                                  ;
 21451                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem

 21454                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 21464 000011AB 83C00F                  	add	ax,15

 21466                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21467                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21469 000011B0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21470 000011B2 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h

 21472 000011B5 CD2F                    	int	2Fh

 21474 000011BA 7508                    	jne	short got_hma

 21476                                  	;zf=1
 21477                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21478                                  	;zf=1
 21479 000011BF 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21480                                  got_hma:

 21482 000011C5 5B                      	pop	bx
 21483 000011C6 C3                      	retn

 21508 000011E2 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0

 21513                                  ; ======================================================================
 21514                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21515                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21516                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21517                                  
 21518                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21519                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21520                                  ;
 21521                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21522                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21523                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21524                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21525                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21526                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21527                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21528                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21529                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21530                                  ;
 21531                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21532                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21533                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21534                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21535                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21536                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21537                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21538                                  ;	conditions:
 21539                                  ;
 21540                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21541                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21542                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21543                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21544                                  ;
 21545                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21546                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21547                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21548                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21549                                  ;
 21550                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21551                                  ;
 21552                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21553                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21554                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21555                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21556                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21557                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21558                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21559                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21560                                  ;
 21561                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21562                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21563                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21564                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21565                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21566                                  ;
 21567                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21568                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21569                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21570                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21571                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21572                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21573                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21574                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21575                                  ;
 21576                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21577                                  
 21578                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21579                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21580                                  
 21581                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21582                                  stackinit:
 21583 000011EF 50                      	push	ax
 21584 000011F0 1E                      	push	ds
 21585 000011F1 06                      	push	es
 21586 000011F2 53                      	push	bx
 21587 000011F3 51                      	push	cx
 21588 000011F4 52                      	push	dx
 21589 000011F5 57                      	push	di
 21590 000011F6 56                      	push	si
 21591 000011F7 55                      	push	bp
 21592                                  
 21593                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21594                                  
 21595                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21596                                  	; ds = cs
 21597 000011F8 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21598 000011FB 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21599                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21600                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21601                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21602 000011FD 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21603                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21604 00001201 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21605 00001204 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21606                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21607 00001208 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21608                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21609                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21610                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21611 0000120B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21612                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21613 0000120F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21614 00001211 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21615                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21616                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21617                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21618 00001214 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21619                                  
 21620                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21621                                  
 21622                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21623                                  
 21624                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21625                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21626                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21627 00001218 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21628                                  
 21629                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21630                                  
 21631 0000121D B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21632                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21633                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21634                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21635 00001220 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21636 00001222 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21637 00001224 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21638 00001228 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21639 0000122A 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21640                                  
 21641                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21642                                  
 21643 0000122D 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21644 00001232 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21645 00001236 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21646 00001238 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21647 0000123A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21648 0000123C 06                      	push	es
 21649 0000123D 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.

 21656                                  
 21657 00001245 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21658                                  
 21659                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21660                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21661                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21662                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21663                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 21664

 22413                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22414                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22415                                  
 22416                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22417                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22418                                  
 22419                                  new_init_loop:
 22420                                  
 22421                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22422                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22423                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22424                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22425                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22426                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22427                                  
 22428 000013E4 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22429 000013E7 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22430 000013E9 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22431 000013ED 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22432                                  
 22433 000013F0 1E                      	push	ds
 22434                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22435                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22436                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22437 000013F1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22438 000013F4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22439 000013F6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22440 000013F9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22441 000013FB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22442 000013FF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22443 00001402 1F                      	pop	ds
 22444                                  
 22445 00001403 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22446 00001406 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22447 0000140A C3                      	retn
 22448                                  
 22449                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22450                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22451                                  
 22452                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22453                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22454                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22455                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22456                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22457                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22458                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22459                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22460                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22461                                  
 22462                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22463                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22464                                  
 22465                                  setdevmark:
 22466                                  
 22467 0000140B 06                      	push	es
 22468 0000140C 51                      	push	cx
 22469                                  
 22470 0000140D 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22471 00001412 2E890E[2C14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22472 00001417 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22473                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22474                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22475 00001419 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22476 0000141D 41                      	inc	cx
 22477                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22478 0000141E 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22479                                  
 22480 00001423 59                      	pop	cx
 22481 00001424 07                      	pop	es
 22482 00001425 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22483 0000142A C3                      	retn

 22733                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22734                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22735                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22736                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22737                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22738                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22739                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22740                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22741                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22742                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22743                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22744                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22745                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22746                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22747                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22748                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22749                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22750                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22751                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22752                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22753                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22754                                  ;	   :
 22755                                  ;
 22756                                  ;Note:
 22757                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22758                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22759                                  ;
 22760                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22761                                  ;
 22762                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22763                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22764                                  ;
 22765                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22766                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22767                                  ;
 22768                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22769                                  ;
 22770                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22771                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22772                                  ;
 22773                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22774                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22775                                  ;
 22776                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22777                                  ;
 22778                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22779                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22780                                  ;
 22781                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22782                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22783                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22784                                  ;
 22785                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22786                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22787                                  ;
 22788                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22789                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22790                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22791                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22792                                  
 22793                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22794                                  
 22795                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22796                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22797                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22798                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22799                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22800                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22801                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22802                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22803                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22804                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22805                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22806                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22807                                  
 22808                                  ;**** Function flags
 22809                                  
 22810                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22811                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22812                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22813                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22814                                  
 22815                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22816                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22817 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22818 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22819 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22820 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22821 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22822 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22823                                  endstruc
 22824                                  
 22825                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22826                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22827                                  ;
 22828                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22829                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22830                                  ;	     +-
 22831                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22832                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22833                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22834                                  ;	     |	:
 22835                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22836                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22837                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22838                                  ;	     |	:
 22839                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22840                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22841                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22842                                  ;	     +-	:
 22843                                  ;
 22844                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22845                                  ;
 22846                                  ;Note:
 22847                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22848                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22849                                  ;
 22850                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22851                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22852                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22853                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22854                                  
 22855                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22856                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22857                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22858                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22859                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22860                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22861                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22862                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22863                                  
 22864                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22865 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22866 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22867 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22868 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22869 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22870                                  endstruc
 22871                                  
 22872                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22873                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22874                                  ;
 22875                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22876                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22877                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22878                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22879                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22880                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22881                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22882                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22883                                  ;
 22884                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22885                                  ;
 22886                                  ;            +-
 22887                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22888                                  ;	    | or
 22889                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22890                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22891                                  ;	    | or
 22892                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22893                                  ;	    | or
 22894                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22895                                  ;	    | or
 22896                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22897                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22898                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22899                                  ;	    | or
 22900                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22901                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22902                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22903                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22904                                  ;	    +-
 22905                                  ;
 22906                                  ;
 22907                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22908                                  ;      list.
 22909                                  ;
 22910                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22911                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22912                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22913                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22914

 22918 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22919 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22920 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22921                                  endstruc

 22931                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 22932                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 22933                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 22934                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22935                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String

 22945                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 22946                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22947                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22948                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22949                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22950                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22951                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22952                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23034                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 23036                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23037                                  ; SysParse;
 23038                                  ;
 23039                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23040                                  ;
 23041                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23042                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23043                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23044                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23045                                  ;
 23046                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23047                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23048                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23049                                  ;
 23050                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23051                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23052                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23053                                  ;
 23054                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23055                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23056                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23057                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23058                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23059                                  ;
 23060                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23061                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23062                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23063                                  ;
 23064                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23065                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23066                                  ;
 23067                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23068                                  ;
 23069                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23070                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23071                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23072                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23073                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23074                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23075                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23076                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23077                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23078                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23079                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23080                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23081                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23082                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23083                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23084                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23085                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23086                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23087                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23088                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23089                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23090                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23091                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23092                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23093                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23094                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23095                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23096                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23097                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23098                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23099                                  
 23100                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23101                                  
 23102                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23103                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23104                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23105                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23106                                  
 23107                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23108                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23109                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23110                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23111                                  ;
 23112                                  
 23113                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23114                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23115                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23116                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23117                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23118                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23119                                  
 23120                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23121                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23122                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23123                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23124                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23125                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23126                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23127                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23128                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23129                                  
 23130                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23131                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23132                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other

 23661                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23662                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23663                                  ;
 23664                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23665                                  ;
 23666                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23667                                  ;	    AL = type
 23668                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23669                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23670                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23671                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23672                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23673                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23674                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23675                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23676                                  ;
 23677                                  ; Output:   None
 23678                                  ;
 23679                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23680                                  ;

 24054                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24055                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24056                                  ;
 24057                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24058                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24059                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24060                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24061                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24062                                  ;
 24063                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24064                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24065                                  ;
 24066                                  ; Output:    None
 24067                                  ;

 24071                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24072                                  
 24073                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24074                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24075                                  
 24076                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24077 000018CF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24078 000018D0 2E800E[4114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24079 000018D6 2E8026[4114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value

 24081 000018DF 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24082 000018E1 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24083

 24086

 24088                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24089 000018ED 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24090                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24091 000018EE E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
