 24993                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24994                                  ;
 24995                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24996                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24997                                  ;
 24998                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24999                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25000                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25001                                  ;
 25002                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25003                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25004                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25005                                  
 25006                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25007                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25008                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25009                                  ;
 25010                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25011                                  
 25012                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25013                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25014                                  
 25015                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25016                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25017 00001C8C 8D2E[4A14]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25018                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25019 00001C90 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25020 00001C92 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25021                                  
 25022                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25023 00001C94 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25024 00001C96 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25025                                  
 25026 00001C98 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25027                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25028                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25029 00001C99 C3                      	retn
 25030                                  
 25031                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25032                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25033                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25034                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25035                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25036                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25037                                  
 25038                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25039                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25040 00001C9A 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25041 00001C9C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25042                                  
 25043 00001C9E 2E800E[4114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25044                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25045                                  
 25046                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25047                                  	; cf=0
 25048                                  	;retn
 25049                                  
 25050                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25051                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25052                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25053 00001CA4 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25054                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25055                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25056 00001CA5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25057                                  
 25058                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25059                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25060                                  ;
 25061                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25062                                  ;
 25063                                  ;  Input:
 25064                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25065                                  ;
 25066                                  ;  Output:
 25067                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25068                                  ;
 25069                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25070                                  ;
 25071                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25072                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25073                                  
 25074                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25075 00001CA6 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25076 00001CA7 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25077 00001CA8 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25078                                  	
 25079 00001CA9 2E833E[3E14]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25080 00001CAF 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25081                                  
 25082 00001CB1 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25083 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25084 00001CB3 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25085 00001CB4 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25086 00001CB5 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25087 00001CB6 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25088 00001CB7 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25089 00001CB8 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25090 00001CBA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 25091 00001CBC B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25092 00001CBF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25093                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25094 00001CC1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25095 00001CC3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25096 00001CC5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25097 00001CC6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25098 00001CC7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25099 00001CC8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25100 00001CC9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25101 00001CCA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25102 00001CCB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25103 00001CCC 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25104                                  
 25105                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25106 00001CCE 2E8936[3C14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25107 00001CD3 2E891E[3E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25108                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25109 00001CD8 2E8B36[3C14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25110 00001CDD 2E8E1E[3E14]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25111                                  
 25112                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25113 00001CE2 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25114 00001CE5 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25115                                  
 25116 00001CE7 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25117 00001CE9 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25118                                  
 25119 00001CEB 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25120 00001CEE 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25121                                  
 25122 00001CF0 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25123 00001CF1 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25124                                  
 25125                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25126 00001CF3 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25127 00001CF4 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25128                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25129 00001CF5 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25130                                  
 25131                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25132                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25133                                  	; cf=0
 25134                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25135                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25136 00001CF7 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25137 00001CF8 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25138 00001CF9 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25139 00001CFA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25140

 25693                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25694                                  
 25695                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25696                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25697                                  
 25698                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25699                                  ;
 25700                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25701                                  ;
 25702                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25703                                  ;
 25704                                  ;   Modification log:
 25705                                  ;
 25706                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25707                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25708                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25709                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25710                                  ;
 25711                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25712                                  ;
 25713                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25714                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25715                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25716                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25717                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25718                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25719                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25720                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25721                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25722                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25723                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25724                                  ;
 25725                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25726                                  
 25727                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25728                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25729                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25730                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25731                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25732                                  
 25733                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25734                                  
 25735                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25736                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25737                                  
 25738                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25739                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25740                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25741                                  
 25742                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25743                                  ;
 25744                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25745                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25746                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25747                                  ;	           line.
 25748                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25749                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25750                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25751                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25752                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25753                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25754                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25755                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25756                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25757                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25758                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25759                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25760                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25761                                  ;	           for details).
 25762                                  
 25763                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25764                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25765                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25766                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25767                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25768                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25769                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25770                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25771                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25772                                  
 25773                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25774                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25775                                  
 25776                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25777                                  
 25778                                  %endif
 25779

 25790 00001EDE 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25791 00001EE0 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25792 00001EE2 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25793 00001EE4 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25794 00001EE8 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25795                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25796                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25797                                  ;
 25798 00001EEC 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25799 00001EED 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25800 00001EEF 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25801 00001EF1 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25802                                  ;

 25804                                  ;

 25806 00001EF9 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor

 25815                                  ;

 25827                                  
 25828                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25829                                  
 25830                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25831                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 25832                                  
 25833                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25834                                  ;
 25835                                  ; procedure : doconf
 25836                                  ;
 25837                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 25838                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 25839                                  ;
 25840                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25841                                  
 25842                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25843                                  doconf:
 25844 00001F11 0E                      	push	cs
 25845 00001F12 1F                      	pop	ds
 25846                                  
 25847 00001F13 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 25848                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 25849 00001F16 CD21                    	int	21h
 25850 00001F18 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 25851                                  
 25852                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25853                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25854                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 25855                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 25856                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25857                                  
 25858 00001F1C BA[7034]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 25859 00001F1F B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 25860                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 25861 00001F22 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25862 00001F23 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25863 00001F25 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 25864                                  
 25865                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25866                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25867                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 25868                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 25869                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 25870 00001F27 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 25871 00001F2C C3                      	retn
 25872                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 25873 00001F2D 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 25874 00001F2F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25875 00001F31 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25876                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 25877 00001F33 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 25878 00001F36 CD21                    	int	21h
 25879 00001F38 A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 25880                                  
 25881 00001F3B 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25882                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 25883 00001F3D B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 25884 00001F40 CD21                    	int	21h
 25885                                  
 25886                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25887                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25888 00001F42 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25889                                  
 25890 00001F46 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25891 00001F49 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25892 00001F4C E86AF1                  	call	ParaRound
 25893 00001F4F 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25894                                  
 25895                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25896                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25897                                  ;;
 25898                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25899                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25900                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25901                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25902                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25903                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25904                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25905                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25906                                  ;;
 25907                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25908                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25909                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25910                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25911                                  
 25912 00001F51 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25913                                  	
 25914                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25915                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25916                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25917 00001F54 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25918 00001F58 E874EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25919                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25920                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25921 00001F5B 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25922                                   
 25923 00001F60 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25924 00001F62 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25925                                  
 25926 00001F64 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25927 00001F66 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25928 00001F6B B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25929                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25930 00001F6D F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25931 00001F6E CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25932 00001F70 9C                      	pushf
 25933                                  
 25934                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25935                                  
 25936 00001F71 50                      	push	ax
 25937 00001F72 57                      	push	di
 25938 00001F73 51                      	push	cx
 25939 00001F74 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25940 00001F76 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25941 00001F78 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25942 00001F7A F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25943 00001F7C 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25944                                  
 25945                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25946                                  
 25947 00001F7E 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25948                                  
 25949                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25950                                  
 25951                                  puteol:
 25952 00001F7F B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25953 00001F81 AA                      	stosb
 25954 00001F82 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25955 00001F84 AA                      	stosb
 25956 00001F85 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25957                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25958                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25959                                  
 25960                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25961                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25962 00001F87 0E                      	push	cs
 25963 00001F88 1F                      	pop	ds
 25964                                  
 25965 00001F89 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25966                                  
 25967 00001F8D 59                      	pop	cx
 25968 00001F8E 5F                      	pop	di
 25969 00001F8F 58                      	pop	ax
 25970                                  
 25971                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25972                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25973                                  	;push	cs
 25974                                  	;pop	ds
 25975                                  
 25976 00001F90 50                      	push	ax
 25977                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25978 00001F91 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25979 00001F93 CD21                    	int	21h
 25980 00001F95 58                      	pop	ax
 25981 00001F96 9D                      	popf
 25982 00001F97 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25983 00001F99 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25984 00001F9B 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25985                                  conferr:
 25986 00001F9D BA[7034]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25987 00001FA0 E8AC13                  	call	badfil
 25988                                  endconv:

 25990                                  
 25991                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25992                                  ;
 25993                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25994                                  ;
 25995                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25996                                  ;
 25997                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25998                                  
 25999                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26000                                  multi_pass:
 26001 00001FA4 0E                      	push	cs
 26002 00001FA5 1F                      	pop	ds
 26003                                  
 26004 00001FA6 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 26005                                  ;jae_endconv:
 26006 00001FAB 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 26007                                  
 26008                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 26009                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26010 00001FAD FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26011 00001FB1 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 26012                                  
 26013 00001FB2 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 26014 00001FB6 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 26015 00001FBA 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 26016 00001FBC 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 26017 00001FC0 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 26018                                  
 26019 00001FC4 E86807                  	call	getchr
 26020 00001FC7 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 26021                                  
 26022                                  getcom:
 26023 00001FC9 E8B10E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 26024 00001FCC E86007                  	call	getchr
 26025                                  conflp: 
 26026 00001FCF 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 26027                                  
 26028 00001FD1 FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26029                                  
 26030 00001FD5 C606[2B14]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26031 00001FDA C606[2E14]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26032 00001FDF 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26033 00001FE1 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26034                                  
 26035                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26036                                  %if 0
 26037                                  
 26038                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26039                                  
 26040                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26041                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26042                                  
 26043                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26044                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26045                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26046                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26047                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26048                                  
 26049                                          push    ax                      ;
 26050                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26051                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26052                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26053                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26054                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26055                                          pop     ax
 26056                                  ;
 26057                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26058                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26059                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26060                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26061                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26062                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26063                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26064                                  ;   spot.
 26065                                  ;
 26066                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26067                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26068                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26069                                  ;   retrieved.
 26070                                  ;
 26071                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26072                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26073                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26074                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26075                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26076                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26077                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26078                                  final:                                  ;
 26079                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26080                                  not_final:                              ;
 26081                                  ;endif
 26082                                  
 26083                                  %endif
 26084 00001FE3 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26085 00001FE5 E84707                  	call	getchr
 26086 00001FE8 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26087                                  
 26088 00001FEA 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26089                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26090                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26091 00001FEF 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26092 00001FF1 E90707                  	jmp	badop
 26093                                  	
 26094                                  coff:	
 26095                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26096                                  	; ds = cs
 26097                                  	;push	cs
 26098                                  	;pop	ds
 26099 00001FF4 E89D10                  	call	newline
 26100 00001FF7 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 26101                                  
 26102                                  blank_line:
 26103 00001FF9 E83307                  	call	getchr
 26104 00001FFC EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 26105                                  
 26106                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26107                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26108                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26109                                  ;coff_p:
 26110                                  	;push	cs
 26111                                  	;pop	ds
 26112                                  
 26113                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26114                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26115                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26116                                  ;install= command.
 26117                                  
 26118                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26119                                  ;install command
 26120                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26121                                  
 26122                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26123                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26124                                  tryi:
 26125 00001FFE 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26126 00002003 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26127 00002005 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26128                                  not_init_pass:
 26129 00002008 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 26130                                          ; 11/12/2022
 26131                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 26132 0000200D 74E5                    	je	short coff
 26133                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26134                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26135                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 26136                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 26137                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 26138                                  					; and before install= commands
 26139                                  					; are processed
 26140                                  
 26141 0000200F 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 26142 00002014 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 26143 00002016 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26144                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26145                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 26146 00002019 74D9                    	je	short coff
 26147                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26148                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26149                                  
 26150                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 26151                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26152                                          
 26153 0000201B 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 26154                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 26155                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26156 0000201E 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 26157                                  	
 26158                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 26159 00002020 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26160                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 26161 00002025 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26162                                  
 26163                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26164                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 26165                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 26166                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 26167                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26168                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26169                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 26170                                  
 26171                                  multi_try_i:
 26172 00002027 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 26173                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 26174                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26175 0000202A 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 26176                                  
 26177                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26178                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26179                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26180                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26181                                  ;;endif
 26182                                  
 26183 0000202C E80AF0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26184 0000202F EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26185                                  
 26186                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26187                                  %if 0
 26188                                  
 26189                                  multi_try_n:
 26190                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 26191                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26192                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26193                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26194                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26195                                  ;endif
 26196                                  
 26197                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26198                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26199                                  
 26200                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 26201                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 26202                                  	mov	bx,ax
 26203                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 26204                                  
 26205                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 26206                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 26207                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 26208                                  
 26209                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26210                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26211                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26212                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26213                                  
 26214                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26215                                  	mov	bx,1
 26216                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26217                                  
 26218                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26219                                  
 26220                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26221                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26222                                          int     21h
 26223                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26224                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26225                                          int     21h
 26226                                  
 26227                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26228                                  
 26229                                  %endif
 26230                                  
 26231                                  multi_pass_filter:
 26232 00002031 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 26233 00002034 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26234 00002036 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 26235 00002039 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26236 0000203B 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 26237 0000203E 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 26238                                  
 26239                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 26240 00002040 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 26241 00002044 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 26242                                  
 26243                                  multi_pass_coff:
 26244                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26245 00002048 EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.

 26247                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26248                                  ; buffer command
 26249                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26250                                  
 26251                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26252                                  ;									      *
 26253                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26254                                  ;									      *
 26255                                  ; input :								      *
 26256                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26257                                  ; output:								      *
 26258                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26259                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26260                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26261                                  ;									      *
 26262                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26263                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26264                                  ; logic:								      *
 26265                                  ; {									      *
 26266                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26267                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26268                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26269                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26270                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26271                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26272                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26273                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26274                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26275                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26276                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26277                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26278                                  ;	};								      *
 26279                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26280                                  ; };									      *
 26281                                  ;									      *
 26282                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26283                                  
 26284                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26285                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26286                                  tryb:
 26287 0000204A 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26288 0000204D 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 26289                                  
 26290                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26291                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26292                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26293                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26294                                  ;;endif
 26295                                  
 26296                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26297                                  	; 18/12/2022
 26298 0000204F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26299                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 26300 00002051 880E[421D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 26301                                  
 26302 00002055 BF[FB1C]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 26303                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 26304                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26305                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26306                                  do7:
 26307 00002058 E87D06                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26308 0000205B 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 26309                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26310                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 26311                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 26312                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26313                                  ;sr7:
 26314                                  	;jmp	coff
 26315                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26316 0000205D E9F605                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26317                                  if7:
 26318 00002060 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 26319 00002063 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 26320                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 26321 00002065 813E[461D][3B1D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 26322                                  	;jne	short if11
 26323                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26324 0000206B 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 26325                                  
 26326                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 26327                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 26328                                  if11:
 26329                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 26330 0000206D A1[481D]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]
 26331 00002070 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1
 26332 00002073 7505                    	jne	short if13
 26333                                  
 26334 00002075 A3[3E1D]                	mov	[p_buffers],ax
 26335                                  	;jmp	short en11
 26336                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26337 00002078 EBDE                    	jmp	short do7
 26338                                  if13:
 26339 0000207A A3[401D]                	mov	[p_h_buffers],ax
 26340                                  en11:
 26341 0000207D EBD9                    	jmp	short do7
 26342                                  en7:
 26343 0000207F 833E[3E1D]63            	cmp	word [p_buffers],99
 26344 00002084 760B                    	jbe	short if18
 26345                                  
 26346                                  ;	cmp	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; M016
 26347                                  ;	jne	short if18
 26348                                  
 26349 00002086 E87E06                  	call	badparm_p
 26350 00002089 C706[401D]0000          	mov	word [p_h_buffers],0
 26351 0000208F EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 26352                                  if18:
 26353 00002091 A1[3E1D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.
 26354 00002094 A3[9702]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.
 26355                                  
 26356 00002097 A1[401D]                	mov	ax,[p_h_buffers]
 26357 0000209A A3[9902]                	mov	[h_buffers],ax
 26358                                  
 26359                                  ;	mov	al,[p_buffer_slash_x]	; M016
 26360                                  ;	mov	[buffer_slash_x],al
 26361                                  
 26362 0000209D A1[2B03]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 26363 000020A0 A3[3503]                	mov	[buffer_linenum],ax ; save the line number for the future use.
 26364                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26365                                  	;jmp	short sr7
 26366                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26367                                  sr7:
 26368 000020A3 E94EFF                  	jmp	coff
 26369                                  
 26370                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26371                                  ; break command
 26372                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26373                                  
 26374                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26375                                  ;									    *
 26376                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26377                                  ;									    *
 26378                                  ; input :								    *
 26379                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26380                                  ; output:								    *
 26381                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26382                                  ;									    *
 26383                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26384                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 26385                                  ; logic:								    *
 26386                                  ; {									    *
 26387                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 26388                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 26389                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26390                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26391                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26392                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26393                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26394                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26395                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26396                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26397                                  ;	};								    *
 26398                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 26399                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 26400                                  ; };									    *
 26401                                  ;									    *
 26402                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26403                                  
 26404                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26405                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 26406                                  tryc:
 26407 000020A6 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 26408 000020A9 7534                    	jne	short trym
 26409                                  
 26410                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26411                                  ;;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG
 26412                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26413                                  ;       jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26414                                  ;;endif
 26415 000020AB BF[4C1D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 26416 000020AE 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26417                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26418                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26419                                  do22:

 26458                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26459                                  
 26460                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26461                                  ;									      *
 26462                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 26463                                  ;									      *
 26464                                  ; input :								      *
 26465                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26466                                  ; output:								      *
 26467                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 26468                                  ;									      *
 26469                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26470                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26471                                  ; logic:								      *
 26472                                  ; {									      *
 26473                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 26474                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26475                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26476                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26477                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26478                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 26479                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 26480                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 26481                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 26482                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 26483                                  ;	};								      *
 26484                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 26485                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *
 26486                                  ;									      *
 26487                                  ; };									      *
 26488                                  ;									      *

 27795                                  trypbad:
 27796 0000253D E9BB01                  	jmp	badop
 27797                                  
 27798                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27799                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27800                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27801                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27802                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27803                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27804                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27805                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27806                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27807                                  
 27808                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27809                                  ;									  *
 27810                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27811                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27812                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27813                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27814                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27815                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27816                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27817                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27818                                  ; input :								  *
 27819                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27820                                  ; output:								  *
 27821                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27822                                  ;									  *
 27823                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27824                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27825                                  ; logic:								  *
 27826                                  ; {									  *
 27827                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27828                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27829                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27830                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27831                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27832                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27833                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27834                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27835                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27836                                  ;	     }								  *
 27837                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27838                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27839                                  ;	};								  *
 27840                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27841                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27842                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27843                                  ; };									  *
 27844                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27845                                  
 27846                                  tryk:
 27847                                          ;if      stacksw
 27848                                  
 27849 00002540 80FC4B                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_STACKS ; 'K'
 27850 00002543 7402                    	je	short do_tryk
 27851                                  skip_it4:
 27852 00002545 EB74                    	jmp	short trys	; 15/12/2022
 27853                                  do_tryk:
 27854                                  	; 30/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27855                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27856                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27857                                  ;       jc	short skip_it4		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27858                                  ;;endif

 28274                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28275                                  
 28276                                  ;***********************************************************************
 28277                                  ;								       *
 28278                                  ; function: parse the option switches specified.		       *
 28279                                  ; note - this command is intended for the future use also.	       *
 28280                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 28281                                  ;								       *
 28282                                  ; input :							       *
 28283                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *
 28284                                  ; output:							       *
 28285                                  ;	p_swit_k set if /k option chosen.			       *
 28286                                  ;								       *

 28288                                  ;	sysinit_parse						       *
 28289                                  ; logic:							       *
 28290                                  ; {								       *
 28291                                  ;	set di points to swit_parms;  /*parse control definition*/     *
 28292                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 					       *
 28293                                  ;	while (end of command line)				       *
 28294                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;					       *

 28296                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == swit_k) then	       *
 28297                                  ;		    p_swit_k = 1				       *

 28515                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28516                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28517                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28518                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28519                                  ;
 28520                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28521                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28522                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28523                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28524                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28525                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28526                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28527                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28528                                  ;	 procedure.
 28529                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28530                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28531                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28532                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28533                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer

 28860                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28861                                  ;
 28862                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28863                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28864                                  ;
 28865                                  ;	Output : none
 28866                                  ;
 28867                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28868                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28869                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28870                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28871                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28872                                  ;
 28873                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28874

 28876                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28877                                  	; ds = cs

 28879                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28880                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28881 0000279B E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28882 0000279E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28883                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28884                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28885                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28886                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28887                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28888                                  	; ds = cs
 28889 000027A0 803E[FB1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28890 000027A5 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28891 000027A7 A1[E21E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28892                                  lim_set:
 28893                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28894                                  	; 11/12/2022

 28896                                  ;limx:
 28897                                  	;retn
 28898                                  	
 28899                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem
