 28903                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28904                                  ;
 28905                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28906                                  ;	Output : none
 28907                                  ;
 28908                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28909                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28910                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28911                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28912                                  ;
 28913                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28914                                  
 28915                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28916                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28917 000027AA 1E                      	push	ds
 28918 000027AB BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28919 000027AE 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28920 000027B0 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28921 000027B4 2E891E[FF1E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28922 000027B9 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28923 000027BB D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28924 000027BD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28925 000027C0 2EC606[FE1E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28926 000027C6 1F                      	pop	ds
 28927                                  ;limx:
 28928 000027C7 C3                      	retn
 28929                                  
 28930                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28931                                  ;
 28932                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28933                                  ;
 28934                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28935                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28936                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28937                                  ;
 28938                                  ;	Output : none
 28939                                  ;
 28940                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28941                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28942                                  ;
 28943                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28944                                  
 28945                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28946                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28947                                  	; ds = cs
 28948 000027C8 803E[FE1E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28949                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28950                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28951                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28952 000027CD 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28953                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28954 000027CF B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28955 000027D2 8826[FE1E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28956                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28957                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28958 000027D6 1E                      	push	ds
 28959                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28960 000027D7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28961 000027D9 2EA1[FF1E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28962 000027DD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28963 000027E0 1F                      	pop	ds
 28964                                  timx:
 28965 000027E1 C3                      	retn
 28966                                  
 28967                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28968                                  ;
 28969                                  ; procedure : IsIt3Com?
 28970                                  ;
 28971                                  ;	Input : DevEntry = Seg:0 of device driver
 28972                                  ;	Output : Zero flag set if device name is 'PROTMAN$'
 28973                                  ;		 else Zero flag is reset
 28974                                  ;
 28975                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28976                                  
 28977                                  IsIt3Com:
 28978                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28979                                  	; ds = cs
 28980 000027E2 1E                      	push	ds
 28981 000027E3 06                      	push	es
 28982 000027E4 56                      	push	si
 28983                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28984 000027E5 C536[E41E]              	lds	si,[DevEntry]
 28985                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 28986 000027E9 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 28987 000027EC 0E                      	push	cs
 28988 000027ED 07                      	pop	es
 28989 000027EE BF[011F]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 28990 000027F1 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 28991 000027F4 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 28992 000027F6 5E                      	pop	si
 28993 000027F7 07                      	pop	es
 28994 000027F8 1F                      	pop	ds
 28995 000027F9 C3                      	retn
 28996                                  
 28997                                  ;M020 : BEGIN
 28998                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28999                                  
 29000                                  UpdatePDB:
 29001 000027FA 1E                      	push	ds
 29002 000027FB B462                    	mov	ah,62h
 29003 000027FD CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET PSP ADDRESS
 29004 000027FF 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx
 29005 00002801 2E8B1E[A302]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]
 29006                                  	;mov	[2],bx
 29007 00002806 891E0200                	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],bx
 29008 0000280A 1F                      	pop	ds
 29009 0000280B C3                      	retn

 29012                                  
 29013                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29014                                  
 29015                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29016                                  
 29017                                  %if 0
 29018                                  
 29019                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29020                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29021                                  
 29022                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29023                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29024                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29025                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29026                                  
 29027                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29028                                  ;
 29029                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29030                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29031                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29032                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29033                                  ;
 29034                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29035                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29036                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29037                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29038                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29039                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29040                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29041                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29042                                  ; available during the load.
 29043                                  ;
 29044                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29045                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29046                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29047                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29048                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29049                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29050                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29051                                  ;
 29052                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29053                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29054                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29055                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29056                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29057                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29058                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29059                                  ;
 29060                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29061                                  
 29062                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29063                                  
 29064                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29065                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29066                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29067                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29068                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29069                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29070                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29071                                  
 29072                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29073                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29074                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29075                                  
 29076                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29077                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29078                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29079                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29080                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29081                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29082                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29083                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29084                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29085                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29086                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29087                                  
 29088                                  InitVar:
 29089                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29090                                  	push	ax
 29091                                  	push	cx
 29092                                  	push	di
 29093                                  	push	es
 29094                                  
 29095                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29096                                  	push	cs
 29097                                  	pop	es
 29098                                  
 29099                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29100                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29101                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29102                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29103                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29104                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29105                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29106                                  
 29107                                  	cld
 29108                                  
 29109                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29110                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29111                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29112                                  
 29113                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29114                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29115                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29116                                  
 29117                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29118                                  
 29119                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29120                                  	pop	es
 29121                                  	pop	di
 29122                                  	pop	cx
 29123                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29124                                  
 29125                                  	retn
 29126                                  
 29127                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29128                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29129                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29130                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29131                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29132                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29133                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29134                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29135                                  
 29136                                  FixMem:
 29137                                  	push	ax
 29138                                  	push	bx
 29139                                  	push	cx
 29140                                  	push	dx
 29141                                  	push	es
 29142                                  
 29143                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29144                                  
 29145                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29146                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29147                                  
 29148                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29149                                  
 29150                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29151                                  
 29152                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29153                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29154                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29155                                  
 29156                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29157                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29158                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29159                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29160                                  
 29161                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29162                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29163                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29164                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29165                                  
 29166                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29167                                  
 29168                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29169                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29170                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29171                                  
 29172                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29173                                  	add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29174                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29175                                  
 29176                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29177                                  
 29178                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29179                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29180                                  
 29181                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29182                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29183                                  	inc	bx
 29184                                  	mov	es,bx
 29185                                  
 29186                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29187                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29188                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29189                                  fmX:	
 29190                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29191                                  
 29192                                  	pop	es
 29193                                  	pop	dx
 29194                                  	pop	cx
 29195                                  	pop	bx
 29196                                  	pop	ax
 29197                                  
 29198                                  	retn
 29199                                  
 29200                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29201                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29202                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29203                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29204                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29205                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29206                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29207                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29208                                  
 29209                                  fm_link:
 29210                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29211                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29212                                  
 29213                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29214                                  	;
 29215                                  	;push	es
 29216                                  	;push	cs
 29217                                  	;pop	es
 29218                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29219                                  	;pop	es
 29220                                  	
 29221                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29222                                  
 29223                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29224                                  	mov	bx,1
 29225                                  	int	21h
 29226                                  	retn
 29227                                  
 29228                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29229                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29230                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29231                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29232                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29233                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29234                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29235                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29236                                  
 29237                                  fm_unlink:
 29238                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29239                                  	
 29240                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29241                                  	;
 29242                                  	;push	ds
 29243                                  	;push	cs
 29244                                  	;pop	ds
 29245                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29246                                  	;pop	ds
 29247                                  	
 29248                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29249                                  
 29250                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29251                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29252                                  	retn
 29253                                  
 29254                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29255                                  
 29256                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29257                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29258                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29259                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29260                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29261                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29262                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29263                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29264                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29265                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29266                                  ;
 29267                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29268                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29269                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29270                                  ;
 29271                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29272                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29273                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29274                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29275                                  ;
 29276                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29277                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29278                                  ;
 29279                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29280                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29281                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29282                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29283                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29284                                  ;     lh
 29285                                  ;     /l
 29286                                  ;     1
 29287                                  ;     1000
 29288                                  ;     2
 29289                                  ;     print
 29290                                  ;     /d
 29291                                  ;     :lpt2
 29292                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29293                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29294                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29295                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29296                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29297                                  ; for:
 29298                                  ;    Each /L
 29299                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29300                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29301                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29302                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29303                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29304                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29305                                  
 29306                                  ParseVar:
 29307                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29308                                  	push	di
 29309                                  	push	ds
 29310                                  	push	es
 29311                                  
 29312                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29313                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29314                                  	cld
 29315                                  
 29316                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29317                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29318                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29319                                  
 29320                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29321                                  	call	isWhite
 29322                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29323                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29324                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29325                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29326                                  
 29327                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29328                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29329                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29330                                  
 29331                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29332                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29333                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29334                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29335                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29336                                  	jne	short pv30
 29337                                  
 29338                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29339                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29340                                  
 29341                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29342                                  	;
 29343                                  	;push	es
 29344                                  	;push	cs
 29345                                  	;pop	es
 29346                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29347                                  	;pop	es
 29348                                  
 29349                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29350                                  
 29351                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29352                                  
 29353                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29354                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29355                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29356                                  
 29357                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29358                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29359                                  
 29360                                  	call	parseL
 29361                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29362                                  
 29363                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29364                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29365                                  
 29366                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29367                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29368                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29369                                  	dec	si
 29370                                  	stc
 29371                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29372                                  	pop	es
 29373                                  	pop	ds
 29374                                  	pop	di
 29375                                  	retn
 29376                                  
 29377                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29378                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29379                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29380                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29381                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29382                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29383                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29384                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29385                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29386                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29387                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29388                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29389                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29390                                  
 29391                                  parseL:
 29392                                  	lodsb
 29393                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29394                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29395                                  
 29396                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29397                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29398                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29399                                  
 29400                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29401                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29402                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29403                                  
 29404                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29405                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29406                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29407                                  
 29408                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29409                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29410                                  
 29411                                  	lodsb
 29412                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29413                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29414                                  
 29415                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29416                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29417                                  
 29418                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29419                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29420                                  
 29421                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29422                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29423                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29424                                  
 29425                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29426                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29427                                  
 29428                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29429                                  
 29430                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29431                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29432                                  
 29433                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29434                                  
 29435                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29436                                  
 29437                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29438                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29439                                  
 29440                                  	lodsb
 29441                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29442                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29443                                  
 29444                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29445                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29446                                  
 29447                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29448                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29449                                  
 29450                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29451                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29452                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29453                                  plE1:	
 29454                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29455                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29456                                  	dec	si
 29457                                  	stc
 29458                                  	retn
 29459                                  
 29460                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29461                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29462                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29463                                  	; cf=1
 29464                                  	;stc
 29465                                  	retn
 29466                                  plSwX:	
 29467                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29468                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29469                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29470                                  	; cf=0
 29471                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29472                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29473                                  
 29474                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29475                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29476                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29477                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29478                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29479                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29480                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29481                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29482                                  
 29483                                  ;incArgc:
 29484                                  	;push	ax
 29485                                  
 29486                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29487                                  
 29488                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29489                                  
 29490                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29491                                  
 29492                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29493                                  
 29494                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29495                                  
 29496                                  	;pop	ax
 29497                                  	;retn
 29498                                  
 29499                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29500                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29501                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29502                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29503                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29504                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29505                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29506                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29507                                  
 29508                                  isEOL:
 29509                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29510                                  	je	short ieX
 29511                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29512                                  	je	short ieX
 29513                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29514                                  ieX:	
 29515                                  	retn
 29516                                  
 29517                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29518                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29519                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29520                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29521                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29522                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29523                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29524                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29525                                  
 29526                                  isWhite:
 29527                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29528                                  	je	short iwX
 29529                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29530                                  	je	short iwX
 29531                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29532                                  iwX:	
 29533                                  	retn
 29534                                  
 29535                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29536                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29537                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29538                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29539                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29540                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29541                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29542                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29543                                  
 29544                                  unMarkUMB:
 29545                                  	push	ax
 29546                                  	push	bx
 29547                                  	push	di
 29548                                  	push	es
 29549                                  
 29550                                  	push	cs
 29551                                  	pop	es
 29552                                  
 29553                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29554                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29555                                  
 29556                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29557                                  	
 29558                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29559                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29560                                  
 29561                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29562                                  	jne	short umu10
 29563                                  
 29564                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29565                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29566                                  umu10:	
 29567                                  	pop	es
 29568                                  	pop	di
 29569                                  	pop	bx
 29570                                  	pop	ax
 29571                                  	retn
 29572                                  
 29573                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29574                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29575                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29576                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29577                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29578                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29579                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29580                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29581                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29582                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29583                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29584                                  
 29585                                  stowUMB:
 29586                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29587                                  	jb	short su10
 29588                                  	stc
 29589                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29590                                  su10:	
 29591                                  	push	bx
 29592                                  	push	di
 29593                                  	push	si
 29594                                  	push	ds
 29595                                  	push	es
 29596                                  	push	cs
 29597                                  	pop	es
 29598                                  	push	cs
 29599                                  	pop	ds
 29600                                  	
 29601                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29602                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29603                                  	jne	short su20
 29604                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29605                                  su20:	
 29606                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29607                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29608                                  
 29609                                  	mov	bl,al
 29610                                  	xor	bh,bh
 29611                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29612                                  
 29613                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29614                                  
 29615                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29616                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29617                                  
 29618                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29619                                  su30:	
 29620                                  	pop	es
 29621                                  	pop	ds
 29622                                  	pop	si
 29623                                  	pop	di
 29624                                  	pop	bx
 29625                                  	retn
 29626                                  
 29627                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29628                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29629                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29630                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29631                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29632                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29633                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29634                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29635                                  
 29636                                  ; 13/05/2019
 29637                                  
 29638                                  stowSiz:
 29639                                  	push	bx
 29640                                  	;push	di ; ?
 29641                                  	push	es
 29642                                  
 29643                                  	push	cs
 29644                                  	pop	es	
 29645                                  
 29646                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 29647                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29648                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29649                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 29650                                  	
 29651                                  	pop	es
 29652                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 29653                                  	pop	bx
 29654                                  
 29655                                  	retn
 29656                                  
 29657                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29658                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29659                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29660                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29661                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29662                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29663                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29664                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29665                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29666                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29667                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29668                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29669                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29670                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29671                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29672                                  
 29673                                  gnradix:
 29674                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29675                                  
 29676                                  toDigit:
 29677                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29678                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29679                                  
 29680                                  toDigit_hex:
 29681                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29682                                  	jb	short td10
 29683                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29684                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29685                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 29686                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29687                                  	retn
 29688                                  td10:	
 29689                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 29690                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 29691                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 29692                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 29693                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 29694                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29695                                  	retn
 29696                                  toDigit_dec:
 29697                                  td20:	
 29698                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 29699                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 29700                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 29701                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 29702                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 29703                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 29704                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29705                                  	retn
 29706                                  tdE:	
 29707                                  	stc
 29708                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 29709                                  	retn
 29710                                  
 29711                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29712                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 29713                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29714                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 29715                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 29716                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 29717                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 29718                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29719                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29720                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29721                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29722                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29723                                  
 29724                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29725                                  
 29726                                  GetXNum:
 29727                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 29728                                  	push	bx
 29729                                  	push	cx
 29730                                  	push	ds
 29731                                  
 29732                                  	cld
 29733                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29734                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29735                                  	xor	cx,cx
 29736                                  	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 29737                                  
 29738                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 29739                                  
 29740                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 29741                                  	;call	toDigit
 29742                                  	call	toDigit_dec
 29743                                  	jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 29744                                  
 29745                                  	or	cl,cl
 29746                                  	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 29747                                  	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 29748                                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 29749                                  	je	short gxn10
 29750                                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 29751                                  	jne	short gxn20
 29752                                  
 29753                                  gxn10:	
 29754                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 29755                                  	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 29756                                  	inc	si
 29757                                  
 29758                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29759                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 29760                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 29761                                  ;        BX    = 0
 29762                                  ;        CH    = 0
 29763                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29764                                  
 29765                                  gxn20:	
 29766                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 29767                                  	inc	si
 29768                                  
 29769                                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 29770                                  	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 29771                                  
 29772                                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 29773                                  	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 29774                                  
 29775                                  	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 29776                                  	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 29777                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 29778                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 29779                                  	jnc	short gxn20
 29780                                  gxnE:	
 29781                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 29782                                  	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 29783                                  gxnQ:	
 29784                                  	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 29785                                  	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 29786                                  gxnX:	
 29787                                  	pop	ds
 29788                                  	pop	cx
 29789                                  	pop	bx
 29790                                  	retn
 29791                                  
 29792                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29793                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 29794                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29795                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 29796                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 29797                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 29798                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29799                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29800                                  
 29801                                  mul32:
 29802                                  	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29803                                  	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29804                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29805                                  	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 29806                                  
 29807                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29808                                  	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29809                                  
 29810                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29811                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29812                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29813                                  	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29814                                  	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29815                                  	retn
 29816                                  m32E:	
 29817                                  	pop	ax
 29818                                  	retn
 29819                                  
 29820                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29821                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 29822                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29823                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 29824                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 29825                                  ; ERROR:   None
 29826                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29827                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29828                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 29829                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 29830                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29831                                  
 29832                                  toPara:
 29833                                  	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 29834                                  
 29835                                  	mov	cl,4		;
 29836                                  	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 29837                                  	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 29838                                  	mov	cl,12
 29839                                  	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 29840                                  	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 29841                                  
 29842                                  	pop	cx
 29843                                  	retn
 29844                                  
 29845                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29846                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 29847                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29848                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 29849                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 29850                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 29851                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29852                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29853                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 29854                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 29855                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 29856                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 29857                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29858                                  
 29859                                  UmbHead:
 29860                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 29861                                  
 29862                                  	;push	si ; ?
 29863                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 29864                                  	;push	es
 29865                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 29866                                  
 29867                                  	; 09/04/2019
 29868                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 29869                                  
 29870                                  	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 29871                                  	int	21h
 29872                                  
 29873                                  	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 29874                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 29875                                  	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 29876                                  
 29877                                  	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 29878                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 29879                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29880                                  	retn
 29881                                  uhE:	
 29882                                  	stc
 29883                                  uhX:	
 29884                                  	;pop	bx ; *
 29885                                  	;pop	es
 29886                                  	;pop	ds ; ?
 29887                                  	;pop	si ; ?
 29888                                  	retn
 29889                                  
 29890                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29891                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 29892                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29893                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 29894                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 29895                                  ; USES:   Flags
 29896                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29897                                  
 29898                                  isSysMCB:
 29899                                  	;push	ax
 29900                                  
 29901                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 29902                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 29903                                  	;je	short ism10
 29904                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 29905                                  	;;je	short ism10
 29906                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 29907                                  	;jne	short ismX
 29908                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 29909                                  	jne	short ismX 
 29910                                  ism10:	
 29911                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 29912                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 29913                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 29914                                  ismX:	
 29915                                  	;pop	ax
 29916                                  	retn
 29917                                  
 29918                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29919                                  
 29920                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29921                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 29922                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29923                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 29924                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 29925                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 29926                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29927                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29928                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 29929                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 29930                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 29931                                  ;      ...
 29932                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 29933                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29934                                  
 29935                                  AddrToUmb:
 29936                                  	push	cx
 29937                                  	push	dx
 29938                                  	push	es
 29939                                  
 29940                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 29941                                  
 29942                                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 29943                                  	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 29944                                  
 29945                                  	mov	es,ax		; ES = first UMB segment
 29946                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 29947                                  
 29948                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 29949                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 29950                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 29951                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 29952                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 29953                                  
 29954                                  atu10:	mov	ax,es
 29955                                          cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 29956                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 29957                                  
 29958                                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 29959                                  	jnz	short atu20
 29960                                  
 29961                                  	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 29962                                  atu20:	
 29963                                  	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 29964                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 29965                                  	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 29966                                  
 29967                                  	;NextMCB es, ax
 29968                                  
 29969                                  	mov     ax,es
 29970                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 29971                                  	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29972                                  	inc     ax
 29973                                  	mov     es,ax
 29974                                  	
 29975                                  	jmp	short atu10
 29976                                  
 29977                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29978                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 29979                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 29980                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29981                                  
 29982                                  atu30:	
 29983                                  	mov	ax,es
 29984                                  	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29985                                  	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 29986                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 29987                                  atuE:	
 29988                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 29989                                  	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 29990                                  atuX:	
 29991                                  	mov	ax, cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 29992                                  	
 29993                                  	pop	es	
 29994                                  	pop	dx
 29995                                  	pop	cx
 29996                                  	retn
 29997                                  
 29998                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29999                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 30000                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 30001                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 30002                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 30003                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30004                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 30005                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 30006                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30007                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30008                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30009                                  
 30010                                  convUMB:
 30011                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30012                                  	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
